commit_message:
Ensure WorkflowSteps resource is enabled in ceph-upgrade-prepare

To trigger ceph-ansible we need to make sure the WorkfowSteps
resource is enabled in ceph-upgrade-prepare env file.

Change-Id: Id760305971a68c397f9334265dd023b1e1884295
Closes-Bug: 1774647
(cherry picked from commit ba8168fe968ba524acff065d38852f9aa7d23480)

commit_message:
Add environments/net-noop.yaml

This can be used to activate net-config-noop.yaml and
disable os-net-config on all roles. Useful if you are using
deployed servers and want to pre-configure your networks.

Change-Id: I80e5fb586f6de0bccd6245237d23712310c78588

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-09 18:12:28.000000000', 'message': "tenacity only supports tornado >= 4.5.0

We would need to raise the min of tornado to 4.5.0 to be 'most' correct.
See https://github.com/jd/tenacity/issues/99 for details
Alternatively we could raise the UC of tenacity to 4.9.0 or above,
but I think that would bring in the updated tornado anyway

Change-Id: Id9ab1de61ab7fba4381e9714f6b0ec6f11239cb3
"}]
commit_message:
tenacity only supports tornado >= 4.5.0

We would need to raise the min of tornado to 4.5.0 to be 'most' correct.
See https://github.com/jd/tenacity/issues/99 for details
Alternatively we could raise the UC of tenacity to 4.9.0 or above,
but I think that would bring in the updated tornado anyway

Change-Id: Id9ab1de61ab7fba4381e9714f6b0ec6f11239cb3

commit_message:
Disable memcached's cachedump

To prevent users walking the memcached keys, Add "-X"
to memcached in both containerized and puppet memcached
overcloud services.

Change-Id: I50eefdbdf7a7911f2ba6a7f3b4e739b8e67a7c1c
Partial-Bug: #1738835

[{'created': '2018-05-04 18:40:15.000000000', 'message': "add the environment attribute to etcd deploy

In ansible/roles/etcd/tasks/config.yml, the kolla_docker
compare_container action doesn't check environment.

Once a container is created, it won't get recreated if only the
environment change. This commit add the environment attribute to the
kolla_docker action in etcd role

Change-Id: I8fb71cc945867e06acc67f6d1256bf62f4276206
Closes-Bug: #1765517
"}]
commit_message:
add the environment attribute to etcd deploy

In ansible/roles/etcd/tasks/config.yml, the kolla_docker
compare_container action doesn't check environment.

Once a container is created, it won't get recreated if only the
environment change. This commit add the environment attribute to the
kolla_docker action in etcd role

Change-Id: I8fb71cc945867e06acc67f6d1256bf62f4276206
Closes-Bug: #1765517

commit_message:
Add note about multiattach not supporting encryption to docs

Per change I613b48a9e89270b2f0266bffc5aeeefad37ce8fb encryption
is not supported with multiattach-capable volumes.

Change-Id: Ife204c380a9d3d12938a907dee6d93d01aaec0ce
Related-Bug: #1770689

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-14 16:47:28.000000000', 'message': 'Make check_can_live_migrate_destination use long_rpc_timeout

This call results in several other RPC calls, which makes it a prime
target for a cascading failure if things are moving slowly. Move this
to the long_rpc_timeout bucket where it can use heartbeats to let the
call go longer if needed.

There was no test_rpcapi test for this method at all, so this adds
one and tweaks the helper as needed to work with it.

Change-Id: I2597ea46efce7c27db4745685f9fabb9da9a883e
'}]
commit_message:
Make check_can_live_migrate_destination use long_rpc_timeout

This call results in several other RPC calls, which makes it a prime
target for a cascading failure if things are moving slowly. Move this
to the long_rpc_timeout bucket where it can use heartbeats to let the
call go longer if needed.

There was no test_rpcapi test for this method at all, so this adds
one and tweaks the helper as needed to work with it.

Change-Id: I2597ea46efce7c27db4745685f9fabb9da9a883e

commit_message:
Pass the correct client to delete_deployment_plan

The method expects the client manager, but before this patch it was
given only the Mistral client. This then fails.

This regression was introduced in I6d41f74f9271c17bcae67eb3c09460051f55667f.

Closes-Bug: #1776872
Change-Id: I2b559a3b030b5c26be9ff3503392e2492e4d7a69

[{'created': '2018-06-06 20:06:23.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I8049df0d8241271122c0587b639c135836846827
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I8049df0d8241271122c0587b639c135836846827
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I266449599e7678b3ec804407bd3a3547cbf2ca3f

commit_message:
making lxc image prestage timeout configurable

aria2 download for lxc image was fired with async: 300.
This can fail when download speed is not sufficient.
Hence it is proposed to make this value configurable
through this fix .

Change-Id: Icb67d86e63cb367204fa74b482044d2435ba70b3
Closes-Bug: #1774348

The goal was to "switch devstack jobs to deploy control-plane API services under uwsgi with Apache acting as a front end proxy." [1]. `mod_wsgi` is deprecated in devstack [2]. I'd prefer to keep devstack as simple as possible and not introduce another deployment method. Stick with `uwsgi` please.

subject: L2gateway driver test cleanup
messages:
[{'account_id': 25587, 'date': '2018-03-13 08:39:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 333, 'date': '2018-03-13 15:53:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 25587, 'date': '2018-03-14 07:05:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 25587, 'date': '2018-03-14 09:25:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 26507, 'date': '2018-03-14 16:17:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

I don't see the logic behind this patch. I think disabling the logging like this and in a setUp function has the potential to be problematic. Could you expand on why you think this patch is needed?"}, {'account_id': 25587, 'date': '2018-03-15 05:24:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> I don't see the logic behind this patch. I think disabling the
 > logging like this and in a setUp function has the potential to be
 > problematic. Could you expand on why you think this patch is
 > needed?

In this test, It is looking for a previously registered log file (a log file which gets created while test_ovs_hostconfig run) to log the warning message but unable to find any log file as the file is temporary one which gets deleted after test_ovs_hostconfig completes it's life cycle. Hence imho we can mock this file, if you can suggest any other approach to solve this issue i would be happy to know.

you can have a look at 
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/536392/ 
This patch has zuul -1 due the issue mentioned above"}, {'account_id': 25587, 'date': '2018-03-16 06:01:05.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from bug/1744259 to l2gateway_cleanup'}, {'account_id': 26507, 'date': '2018-03-19 08:37:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> > I don't see the logic behind this patch. I think disabling the
 > > logging like this and in a setUp function has the potential to be
 > > problematic. Could you expand on why you think this patch is
 > > needed?
 > 
 > In this test, It is looking for a previously registered log file (a
 > log file which gets created while test_ovs_hostconfig run) to log
 > the warning message but unable to find any log file as the file is
 > temporary one which gets deleted after test_ovs_hostconfig
 > completes it's life cycle. Hence imho we can mock this file, if you
 > can suggest any other approach to solve this issue i would be happy
 > to know.
 > 
 > you can have a look at
 > https://review.openstack.org/#/c/536392/
 > This patch has zuul -1 due the issue mentioned above

I don't think the solution is mocking the logger in this way. This is like curing the symptoms but not the underlying cause (like when you have a stomach ache and you take something so it won't ache. That won't cure your ulcer, just not make you feel and then it will come to bite you back). 

You need to find the way to refactor the code to be testeable and to refactor the tests to behave correctly."}, {'account_id': 25587, 'date': '2018-06-15 09:21:52.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

as V1 driver is being deprecated, this should be of no consequence.'}]

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-14 14:31:31.000000000', 'message': 'Allow the cpu_shared_set to be configurable

commit_message:
Allow the cpu_shared_set to be configurable

This patch allows puppet-nova to set [compute]/cpu_shared_set.

Fixes bug 1776905

Change-Id: I5b15258e3bf6192b0bff71fb080a1db323456a66

commit_message:
Add/rm centralized fips for DVR+HA from standby node

For DVR+HA:
When adding/removing a centralized fip, just add/remove it to/from
keepalived instance and do not check if it is a master router.

When adding a centralized fip, it is still needed to invoke method
of supperclass to configure nat rules on master node.

When removing a centralized fip, it is still needed to invoke method
of supperclass to clean contrack on master node.

Change-Id: I202db59acb7fb0b7924748cf7def2879a748e56a
Closes-Bug: #1736068

commit_message:
ovs: removed sinkhole RPC target for old topics

The oslo.messaging bug that triggered adding the hack is fixed in
Queens, so we don't need it anymore.

Change-Id: I775b466dce19c4168985b19e1ddb938118f48dcb

commit_message:
Don't run setfiles on /boot/efi

setfiles isn't supported on the vfat /boot/efi partition.  Add it to
the skip list.

Tested on Fujitsu Server successfully.

Change-Id: Iab262c4bdb0ecc25ca6b77ee4aff1ce442c0c578

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-14 11:34:59.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Make sure memcached log dir permission survive reboot.

We currently change the permission of the /var/log/memcached.log
file.  But on some distribution (rhel) it seems that the memcached
process can move this file to "log.1" (but couldn't find a logrotate
culprit here).  This make the next reboot unsuccessful as trying to
write to the non existant /var/log/memcached.log file fail with
permission error.

Putting this as WIP as:
 0. I cannot tell what is moving the log to log.1 so there is a root
 cause missing here.
 1. some memcached containers achieve to run after reboot even with
 that issue (see the lp)
 2. it cannot seems to happen on upstream (to be tested -- do we
 reboot sometime)
 3. the redirection happen also in the OPTION so the complete command
 look like this:

    /usr/bin/memcached -p 11211 -u memcached -m 16005 -c 8192 -vv -l 172.17.1.14 -U 0 -t 8 >> /var/log/memcached.log 2>&1 >> /var/log/memcached.log 2>&1

 Accorting to [1], the redirection in the $OPTIONS should be ignored by
 le memcached so it's not necessary to change it in there although it
 might be confusing.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/blob/master/docker/services/memcached.yaml#L98..L106

Change-Id: Iaaf7232c9698bb20868957aab9cd9b318199efd8
Related-Bug: #1776889
'}, {'created': '2018-06-14 14:40:23.000000000', 'message': 'Make sure memcached log permission survive log rotation.

We currently change the permission of the /var/log/memcached.log
file.

But on some distribution (rhel) it seems that the memcached process
can move this file to "log.1" (but couldn't find a logrotate culprit
here).

This makes the next reboot unsuccessful as trying to write to the non
existant /var/log/memcached.log file fail with a permission error.

So this patch aims at making the logs permission more robust.  If that
file is rotated or deleted, the container can still be started.

Note that the redirection happens also in the $OPTION variable from
/etc/sysconfig/memcached so the complete command look like this:

    /usr/bin/memcached -p 11211 -u memcached -m 16005 -c 8192 -vv -l 172.17.1.14 -U 0 -t 8 >> /var/log/memcached.log 2>&1 >> /var/log/memcached.log 2>&1

But accorting to [1], (and my personal testing) the redirection in the
$OPTIONS is ignored by le memcached so it's not necessary to change it
in there although it might be confusing.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/blob/master/docker/services/memcached.yaml#L98..L106

Change-Id: Iaaf7232c9698bb20868957aab9cd9b318199efd8
Related-Bug: #1776889
'}]
commit_message:
Make sure memcached log permission survive log rotation.

We currently change the permission of the /var/log/memcached.log
file.

But on some distribution (rhel) it seems that the memcached process
can move this file to "log.1" (but couldn't find a logrotate culprit
here).

This makes the next reboot unsuccessful as trying to write to the non
existant /var/log/memcached.log file fail with a permission error.

So this patch aims at making the logs permission more robust.  If that
file is rotated or deleted, the container can still be started.

Note that the redirection happens also in the $OPTION variable from
/etc/sysconfig/memcached so the complete command look like this:

    /usr/bin/memcached -p 11211 -u memcached -m 16005 -c 8192 -vv -l 172.17.1.14 -U 0 -t 8 >> /var/log/memcached.log 2>&1 >> /var/log/memcached.log 2>&1

But accorting to [1], (and my personal testing) the redirection in the
$OPTIONS is ignored by le memcached so it's not necessary to change it
in there although it might be confusing.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/blob/master/docker/services/memcached.yaml#L98..L106

Change-Id: Iaaf7232c9698bb20868957aab9cd9b318199efd8
Related-Bug: #1776889

 > > > The enable root and disable root are a good solution.
 > > >
 > > > I suspect that because of the lack of the redis roll restart
 > > > function, there is no related configuration function. For
 > config
 > > > like tcp-backlog that need to restart the node, more effective
 > > flow
 > > > control is needed in the cluster.
 > >
 > > Oh, if the Redis configuration is modified manually, then
 > > restarting guestagent should be necessary, and I think it's safe
 > to
 > > restart guestagent(i.e restarting guestageng souldn't affecting
 > the
 > > running Redis server).
 > >
 > > 'rolling_configuration_update' and 'rolling_configuration_remove'
 > > in trove/cluster/models.py, they seems generic for all datastore
 > > backend. However I have no confidence here, these functions
 > should
 > > be tested again Redis and MongoDB.
 > 
 > Yes, restarting guestagent can solve this problem, but I am a bit
 > worried that this is only temporary, or it will trigger other
 > problems (just like our original config rename, after the restart,
 > some objects stored in memory are lost)
 > Redis may be a special presence in all databases, because his ping
 > method requires permissions, and we may be able to look at the
 > redis process to replace this scheme.

Yes, we don't have much choice here. For restarting guestagent, I think only those long running tasks(like createing instance/replication/cluster, backup, restore, etc) need to be considered, otherwise it should be safe.

I think refining _get_actual_db_status of RedisAppStatus may also work(need to be verified).'}]

[{'created': '2018-06-14 08:04:51.000000000', 'message': 'Temporarily solve requirepass in redis cluster

Our redis cluster does not yet support mounting configuration.
This leads to the fact that when we need to manually add requirepass
to redis.conf for security reasons in redis cluster, this action
will not be perceived by the trove-guestagent.

I am making temporary changes. Make it possible to rebuild the
client with redis.conf every time when get redis status.

This is a temporary solution that will be deprecated as
the redis cluster supports the configuration configuration policy.

Change-Id: Ia96d2f91664061fa084a5edf374af12f87c830b6
'}]
commit_message:
Temporarily solve requirepass in redis cluster

Our redis cluster does not yet support mounting configuration.
This leads to the fact that when we need to manually add requirepass
to redis.conf for security reasons in redis cluster, this action
will not be perceived by the trove-guestagent.

I am making temporary changes. Make it possible to rebuild the
client with redis.conf every time when get redis status.

This is a temporary solution that will be deprecated as
the redis cluster supports the configuration configuration policy.

Change-Id: Ia96d2f91664061fa084a5edf374af12f87c830b6

subject: WIP: PUT POST: Use 100 Continue response header to signal object server version
messages:
[{'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2018-06-14 17:49:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 597, 'date': '2018-06-14 18:11:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Getting rid of extra headers in 100-continue was the original primary motivation for the PUT+POST. If you do this, there's basically no point in doing the whole thing in the first place."}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2018-06-14 21:36:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Ah, I had understood the bug [1] to be more to do with sending extra "0\r\n\r\n" bytes, I hadn't appreciated that the headers after 100 status code in response were also non-compliant.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/swift/+bug/1496636'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2018-06-14 22:03:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I think it's both, but for different reasons.

The 0\r\n\r\n in the middle of the PUT stream is the bad one. That makes our protocol not HTTP any more, just mostly HTTP-like. Convincing HTTP libraries other than eventlet.wsgi to deal with that is darn near impossible.

The 100-Continue headers are legal HTTP, but hardly anybody supports them, so if you wanted to use net/http in Go, for example, you'd have to rewrite a pretty sizable amount of it in order to send 100-Continue headers."}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2018-06-15 08:18:40.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

bad idea'}]

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-21 14:46:36.000000000', 'message': "Don't set administratively disabled ports as ACTIVE

There was race condition during updating port to disable it.
In case when neutron-server receives port update call to set
admin_state_down on port, it sends PORT_UPDATE notification
to agents.

Then both L2 and DHCP agent starts doing its job with port.
L2 agent asks neutron-server about device details and during
processing this call server sets port's status to DOWN if
its admin_state_up = False.
Problem is that sometimes just after that, DHCP port will send
to neutron server notification that provisioning for this port
is finished.
As there is no any other provisioning block in db (because it
is just port update) neutron-server is setting port's status
to ACTIVE.

This patch fixes this issue by allowing to transition to
ACTIVE only ports which are administratively enabled.

Change-Id: If506e0ff68fc49748f19618470c85901339a419b
Closes-Bug: #1757089

commit_message:
Don't set administratively disabled ports as ACTIVE

There was a race condition during port update to disable it.
In case when neutron-server receives port update call to set
admin_state_down on port, it sends PORT_UPDATE notification
to agents.

Then both L2 and DHCP agents start doing their job with port.
L2 agent asks neutron-server about device details and during
processing this call server sets port's status to DOWN if
its admin_state_up = False.
Problem is that sometimes just after that, DHCP agent will send
to neutron server notification that provisioning for this port
is finished.
As there is no any other provisioning block in db (because it
is just port update) neutron-server is setting port's status
to ACTIVE.

This patch fixes this issue by allowing to transition to
ACTIVE only ports which are administratively enabled.

Change-Id: If506e0ff68fc49748f19618470c85901339a419b
Closes-Bug: #1757089

commit_message:
Don't enable 'fake' driver, instead use hardware-type

Ironic removed the 'fake' drivers in [1], this
patch removes it setup in poi, instead set
fake-hardware in enabled_hardware_types.

Also add other ironic, tempest config required by
fake-hardware type.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/572454/

Depends-On: I47e886f67e51edf8f4cee3ded44496287d2298d4
Change-Id: I7ea51b6bcee0a93dda7ff54fd3388469d14a9ba8

subject: Correct defaults
messages: [{'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-06-12 15:16:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2018-06-12 17:21:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2018-06-15 07:21:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-12 15:16:32.000000000', 'message': 'Correct defaults

The `is_container` and `cache_timeout` needed to be updated to
accomodate a typical deployment.

The cache timeout was being defined as a default and as a variable
which is loaded at the start of the role. This make it impossible to
override this option. The `cache_timeout` option has been removed
from the variable files. Because this option is defined in the
defaults it will retain it's current functionality but allow deployers
to override this option.

The `is_container` default was using the `ansible_virtualization_type`
and checking if the string was returned as "lxc". This option was updated
to now also detect if the container type is "systemd-nspawn".

Change-Id: I4d65a7f83055d0483aaf23f487551341686396c6
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Correct defaults

The `is_container` and `cache_timeout` needed to be updated to
accomodate a typical deployment.

The cache timeout was being defined as a default and as a variable
which is loaded at the start of the role. This make it impossible to
override this option. The `cache_timeout` option has been removed
from the variable files. Because this option is defined in the
defaults it will retain it's current functionality but allow deployers
to override this option.

The `is_container` default was using the `ansible_virtualization_type`
and checking if the string was returned as "lxc". This option was updated
to now also detect if the container type is "systemd-nspawn".

Change-Id: I4d65a7f83055d0483aaf23f487551341686396c6
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Iptables firewall driver adds forward rules for trusted ports

Iptables firewall driver can now add process trusted ports and
adds rules for them to FORWARD chain.

Change-Id: I67d0f17b4b56671fc2e2dd6e2fc4518dc42cd131
Closes-Bug: #1720205

'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ia9c73f1f653d7a22354c9478672ba6c5e7a7928c
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-13 19:31:59.000000000', 'message': 'fix warnings in documentation build

Replace the :option: role markup with simpler literal text markup so
that options that are not defined anywhere in the documentation do not
produce warnings.

Turn on the -W option in the docs environment in tox so that local
developer builds of the documentation fail if there is a warning.

Change-Id: I4a97b1efbfddc6137668c23461a882fa589d4999
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
fix warnings in documentation build

Replace the :option: role markup with simpler literal text markup so
that options that are not defined anywhere in the documentation do not
produce warnings.

Turn on the -W option in the docs environment in tox so that local
developer builds of the documentation fail if there is a warning.

Change-Id: I4a97b1efbfddc6137668c23461a882fa589d4999
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

(1 comment)

IMO, the current implementation, using named pipes is valid with some modifications.

In winutils L263 I made a comment about how the read operation is managed.

In winutils.ProcessWithNamedPipes.communicate L511, stdout is filled with a read buffer, but this buffer could be incomplete (this function do nothing with ERROR_IO_PENDING). If stdout != None (although this output is incomplete), won't call in L521 "self._get_result_namedpipe".

I think this is the problem with the current implementation.

IMO, it's better to fix it than to revert to the old one.'}, {'account_id': 8543, 'date': '2017-08-29 10:07:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)

@Rodolfo: thanks for looking at this change.

As mentioned inline, there are multiple issues with the current implementation. I see no point in trying to patch it up (it may need some substantial changes) since we can just use subprocess, greatly simplifying the code.'}, {'account_id': 8543, 'date': '2017-09-11 15:23:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

For what is worth, this patch is not just a plain revert of the named pipe change. It's also fixing the eventlet related issue, which was the reason why the named pipe based implementation was actually introduced."}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2017-09-12 07:20:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: -Code-Review

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2017-09-12 07:28:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 8543, 'date': '2018-01-04 10:42:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

@Rodolfo: Thank you for the suggestions. Still, I'd rather stick with subprocess.Popen as it's much more simple and less error prone. We've thoroughly tested this change and it's working as intended.

I need to stress the fact that without this change, exec calls are broken on Windows, yet this patch has been hanging like this for quite a while. I really hope it will be merged in time for Queens, otherwise we'll have to take it downstream."}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2018-01-04 10:59:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 8543, 'date': '2018-01-29 11:08:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 8543, 'date': '2018-01-29 11:10:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-08-09 11:42:24.000000000', 'message': "[wip] Windows: switch back to subprocess.Popen for exec calls

At some point, we've switched to an alternative process launcher
that uses named pipes to communicate with the child processes. This
implementation has some issues, truncating the process output in some
situations.

This change switches back to subprocess.Popen, which is a much easier
and convenient way to perform exec calls. We're also ensuring that the
os module is not patched (which would cause subprocess.Popen to fail
on Windows due to an eventlet limitation, the reason why the above
mentioned implementation was first introduced).

We're also ensuring that such calls do not block other greenthreads
by leveraging eventlet.tpool.

Change-Id: Ib58e12030e69ea10862452c2f141a7a5f2527621

"}, {'created': '2018-02-01 15:06:46.000000000', 'message': 'Windows: fix exec calls

At some point, we've switched to an alternative process launcher
that uses named pipes to communicate with the child processes. This
implementation has some issues, truncating the process output in some
situations.

This change switches back to subprocess.Popen, which is a much easier
and convenient way to perform exec calls. We're also ensuring that the
os module is not patched (which would cause subprocess.Popen to fail
on Windows due to an eventlet limitation, the reason why the above
mentioned implementation was first introduced).

We're also ensuring that such calls do not block other greenthreads
by leveraging eventlet.tpool.

Side note: I had to store subprocess.Popen in a variable in order
to avoid having OpenStack bandit complaining, even though we're
explicitly passing "shell=False":
http://paste.openstack.org/raw/658319/

Closes-Bug: #1709931

Change-Id: Ib58e12030e69ea10862452c2f141a7a5f2527621
'}]
commit_message:
Windows: fix exec calls

At some point, we've switched to an alternative process launcher
that uses named pipes to communicate with the child processes. This
implementation has some issues, truncating the process output in some
situations.

This change switches back to subprocess.Popen, which is a much easier
and convenient way to perform exec calls. We're also ensuring that the
os module is not patched (which would cause subprocess.Popen to fail
on Windows due to an eventlet limitation, the reason why the above
mentioned implementation was first introduced).

We're also ensuring that such calls do not block other greenthreads
by leveraging eventlet.tpool.

Side note: I had to store subprocess.Popen in a variable in order
to avoid having OpenStack bandit complaining, even though we're
explicitly passing "shell=False":
http://paste.openstack.org/raw/658319/

Closes-Bug: #1709931

Change-Id: Ib58e12030e69ea10862452c2f141a7a5f2527621

Thanks!  Some changes needed for the readme. The open-scsi-config feedback, is more a nit than anything else.'}, {'account_id': 21741, 'date': '2017-10-14 07:20:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

I'm not sure if DIB is the right place to go for this element:

Only very few people will use this IMHO.

But the major problem is testing: we cannot support something, which is not tested. So if the element should be directly included into DIB, please add a test case that shows that it is working (not only the image build, but also the boot functionality).

IMHO this element should be placed in the appropriate project where there might be an easy way of testing."}, {'account_id': 11929, 'date': '2017-10-16 13:20:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(3 comments)

Thanks for the reviews Andreas and Julia!

@ansreas - This element is intended for the Ironic boot from volume feature, though it is generic enough that it could be useful for configuring an ubuntu/debian image for iscsi boot in general. Would you suggest we have this in the ironic tree? My concern there is that other ironic elements (ironic-agent) have historically been in the DIB project. I probably need to look at DIB testing more closely.'}, {'account_id': 11929, 'date': '2017-12-07 22:51:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2017-12-08 22:24:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

@Andreas, I think DIB is absolutely the correct place to have this element.

The changes are intended to tell the ramdisk to attempt to read the iscsi target information from ram upon boot. This can also be for hardware initiators, and not just software iscsi initiators. Previously, people have been having to hack their ramdisks manually to include support which is naturally problematic.

With Zuulv3, it is at least easy enough for us to define a job in ironic that could be just defined in the DIB job list and then executed as such. We have a BFV test already, we would just need to adapt it to use something other than cirros.'}, {'account_id': 11929, 'date': '2017-12-12 17:15:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 7979, 'date': '2017-12-13 20:48:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

How can I contact you for more discussion? Do you prefer email or IRC?"}, {'account_id': 11929, 'date': '2018-04-04 14:00:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Hello Hoang, I've obviously been neglecting this patch since the last revision. If you want to add centos support, I would prefer that your "Add iscsi-boot element" patch was dependent on this one and added only the changes necessary for centos.

Please reach out to me on my email <mjturek@linux.vnet.ibm.com> or on freenode <mjturek> so we can work this out.

If you have already emailed me, I may have missed it as I had some trouble with our internal imap.'}, {'account_id': 11929, 'date': '2018-04-04 14:04:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Oh, looks like you list the patch as depends-on, but I think your patch should be based on (applied on top of) this one.'}, {'account_id': 25254, 'date': '2018-06-01 01:18:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 25254, 'date': '2018-06-12 06:15:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Thanks'}, {'account_id': 25254, 'date': '2018-06-14 02:57:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5: Patch Set 4 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-06-15 05:15:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2

unlike the centos case, i'm not aware we have a generic or centalised place for running the initramfs update on debian/ubuntu.  clearly it's of interest to people, so i think we're better of having this in so it can be useful"}, {'account_id': 6133, 'date': '2018-06-15 06:51:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Add iscsi-boot element

This patch adds an element that handles the configuration for
creating a disk capable of being a remote root filesystem through
iSCSI on Ubuntu and Debian images.

Change-Id: Ibf9e39d2bdab530106015f156d23d28029d12b0d
Closes-bug: #1716794

commit_message:
Remove the 'id' attribute from capsule

We have 'uuid' as end-users facing ID. The 'id' is an internal
ID in database so it should not be exposed.

Change-Id: I8611970daa96da5203d1473bc24d5536b7646a95

commit_message:
Update heartbeat to make better use of variables

While functional the heartbeat config was hashing a lot data more than
once. This change updates the template to make better use of it's known
variables.

Change-Id: Ia54e25ef483e83f4725a9a0678906134fa315e44
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
dev mode: Add support for congress

Provide support for kolla dev mode in congress. When
'kolla_dev_mode' or 'congress_dev_mode' variables are
enabled, source code of congress project is cloned
and bind mounted.

Partially implements: blueprint mount-sources

Change-Id: Ie6bf33aaac98d237032410a7c0a6e60e35a3fb00

commit_message:
Update filebeat

Several new options have been added to the filebeat template, while
these options have not been enabled, they have been added so operators
know which options they have.

Other logging options have been consolodated which will cut down on
boilerplate code.

Change-Id: I640878f41f782a088ed9edd49284f907ad3b6460
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

Bubble up the exception to the resource tracker if ironic is down, as
returning an empty list of nodes can cause all sorts of crazy behavior.

TODO: don't crash if ironic is down on startup.

Change-Id: Ib0ec1012b74e9a9e74c8879f3feed5f9332b711f

"}, {'created': '2018-03-16 17:11:26.000000000', 'message': 'ironic: stop lying to the RT when ironic is down

Returning an empty list of nodes can cause all sorts of crazy behavior,
so we instead bubble up a NotReadyYet exception, which the compute
manager will ignore.

Change-Id: Ib0ec1012b74e9a9e74c8879f3feed5f9332b711f
Related-Bug: #1744139
Closes-Bug: #1750450
'}, {'created': '2018-03-20 13:03:56.000000000', 'message': 'ironic: stop lying to the RT when ironic is down

Related-Bug: #1744139
Closes-Bug: #1750450
'}, {'created': '2018-03-20 19:13:20.000000000', 'message': 'ironic: stop lying to the RT when ironic is down

Returning an empty list of nodes can cause all sorts of crazy behavior,
so we instead bubble up a VirtDriverNotReady exception, which the compute

Change-Id: Ib0ec1012b74e9a9e74c8879f3feed5f9332b711f
Related-Bug: #1744139
Closes-Bug: #1750450
'}]
commit_message:
ironic: stop lying to the RT when ironic is down

Returning an empty list of nodes can cause all sorts of crazy behavior,
so we instead bubble up a VirtDriverNotReady exception, which the compute
manager will ignore.

Change-Id: Ib0ec1012b74e9a9e74c8879f3feed5f9332b711f
Related-Bug: #1744139
Closes-Bug: #1750450

subject: fix tox python3 overrides
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-12 05:52:47.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ib91d3237d30e75b3c31ce0f90ddfb1288dfd97b4
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ib91d3237d30e75b3c31ce0f90ddfb1288dfd97b4

commit_message:
Fix copy external ceph files from custome/gnocchi in gnocchi

There is no need to load custom ceph.conf and keyring from different
folder for gnocchi components. Just load the files from
node_custom_config/gnocchi folder.

Depends-On: I379ff17856509c9321b86c13a72eacc18f5c1202
Change-Id: Id553dff274a29d82fb1b743437e3656d6f817e52

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-14 14:58:11.000000000', 'message': "Vault version in snap store may not start with 'v'

The nagios check that checks the snap store version matches the
deployed assumes that the version info in the snap store starts
a 'v'. If it doesn't it return None. This fixes that.

Change-Id: I89f56866c78b286e7d07b43432d56aa41a0c2eb9
(cherry picked from commit e0030882773aaa18078d8dc1d1eab122ebafcd2f)

commit_message:
Vault version in snap store may not start with 'v'

The nagios check that checks the snap store version matches the
deployed assumes that the version info in the snap store starts
a 'v'. If it doesn't it return None. This fixes that.

Change-Id: I89f56866c78b286e7d07b43432d56aa41a0c2eb9
(cherry picked from commit e0030882773aaa18078d8dc1d1eab122ebafcd2f)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-14 23:48:52.000000000', 'message': 'Blacklist eventlet 0.23.0

See https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/issues/488 -- any URLs with
"%80" through "%ff" in their path will most likely cause 500s on
Python 2. At the very least, this is known to break Swift's functional
tests.

FWIW, there's a fix: https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/pull/497

Change-Id: Ieb895eded03e3aabef8ac1ed69bd45d11f44b776
'}]
commit_message:
Blacklist eventlet 0.23.0

See https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/issues/488 -- any URLs with
"%80" through "%ff" in their path will most likely cause 500s on
Python 2. At the very least, this is known to break Swift's functional
tests.

FWIW, there's a fix: https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/pull/497

Change-Id: Ieb895eded03e3aabef8ac1ed69bd45d11f44b776

messages:
[{'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-06-14 19:24:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-06-15 03:24:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Looks good to me.

This is also used in IPA but they have the same conditionals and potential cleanup once this is merged.

 Package      : rtslib-fb [rtslib-fb!=2.1.60,!=2.1.61,!=2.1.64,>=2.1.43] (used by 2 projects)
 Included in  : 1 projects
 openstack/cinder                              [cycle-with-milestones]
 Also affects : 1 projects
 openstack/ironic-python-agent                 [cycle-with-intermediary]'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2018-06-15 04:17:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-14 19:24:15.000000000', 'message': "Raise minimum for rtslib_fb to 2.1.65

Prior to 2.1.52 this package's namespace was rtslib, then became
rtslib_fb. This results in cinder having conditional imports
wherever this is used.

Newer versions have been out long enough now that we should be
safe upgrading. Since there were a few blacklisted releases, this
raises the minumum version past these known bad versions.

Change-Id: I5c3bd96ad5571d8c5a3a19d553bed03c9a1ec194
"}]
commit_message:
Raise minimum for rtslib_fb to 2.1.65

Prior to 2.1.52 this package's namespace was rtslib, then became
rtslib_fb. This results in cinder having conditional imports
wherever this is used.

Newer versions have been out long enough now that we should be
safe upgrading. Since there were a few blacklisted releases, this
raises the minumum version past these known bad versions.

Change-Id: I5c3bd96ad5571d8c5a3a19d553bed03c9a1ec194

The sniffing and template generation process will be enabled or disabled
when run along side data/ingest nodes. This will cut down on network IO

Change-Id: Ic289a2b8005cc76570420d74a2b46e2f1eccafbd

commit_message:
Disable sniffing for elasticsearch output

The sniffing and template generation process will be enabled or disabled
when run along side data/ingest nodes. This will cut down on network IO
as the logstash output will use localhost to communicate to
elasticsearch whenever possible.

Change-Id: Ic289a2b8005cc76570420d74a2b46e2f1eccafbd
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

include deployment instructions for two separate applications on
different ports.

Related-bug: #1754104

Change-Id: I98fae626d39cb62ad51c86435c1a2c60be5c1fb9
"}]
commit_message:
Replace port 35357 with 5000 for test_clients.py

Now that the v2.0 API has been removed, we don't have a reason to
include deployment instructions for two separate applications on
different ports.

Related-bug: #1754104

Change-Id: I98fae626d39cb62ad51c86435c1a2c60be5c1fb9

commit_message:
Add retries to all tasks with external deps

The tasks with external deps should all have a retry so to cater for
cases of intermittent service interruptions. This change adds retires
and tags to of the tasks with external deps.

Change-Id: Icd0a8143347bcbffc2a1e0a02da92091b59ed483
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Store JSON Home Resources off the composing router

JSON Home Resources must be stored in a location other
than the router for Flask as we are not composing routers
in the same way as we used to with the home-grown webob
based WSGI setup.

Partial-Bug: #1776504
Closes-Bug: #1776506
Change-Id: I292ea9e923ff2f49041dfd417994bcdd797d0520

commit_message:
Update metricbeat to monitor new services

New services like etcd kvm and docker have all been added to metric beat
so that we're able to monitor these services automatically.

Change-Id: Ie4be3717119a86e19b09957ad2eb867e94a144ea
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Support same projects in different domain

Getting 500 error when there are same project name
in different domain.
Selecting one domain from service_credentials.
e.g. services(or service) projects are in default and service_domain
having differrent id. so this selects default's services project
instead of service_domain's services project

Closes-Bug: #1776375
Change-Id: Ibb79423a06062f2e00785c30f54e7ac2a41a4705

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-21 01:01:45.000000000', 'message': 'Improve path handling in proxy_logging

In the access log, proxy_logging places the URL path,
double-URL-encoded (e.g. " " -> %20 -> %2520).

In the WSGI environment, env['PATH_INFO'] is the unquoted path sent by
the client, e.g. "/v1/a/c/o" or "/v1/a/c/obj with spaces" or
"/v1/a/c/u-\xf0\x9f\xa4\x94". On the request, we have the "path"
attribute, which returns the quoted form of env["PATH_INFO"].

Note that, under Python 2, these are always str objects, not unicode.

Swift used to log this:

    quote(quote(unquote(
        req.path.decode('utf-8', 'replace').encode('utf-8')), "/:"))

There's a lot going on here. Let's look at the innermost expression:

    req.path.decode('utf-8', 'replace').encode('utf-8')

This appears to be trying to replace invalid UTF-8 sequences with the
Unicode replacement character. However, since we start from
"req.path", which quotes its input, we don't have any non-ASCII bytes,
so the decode/encode is a no-op. That is, if env["PATH_INFO"] had
"\xff\xff" in it, req.path would have "%FF%FF", so there's no invalid
byte sequences to escape.

So, without changing the output, we can simplify the above code to:

    quote(quote(unquote(req.path), "/:"))

The second call to quote() has a second argument of "/:", so neither
slashes or colons are quoted. This was introduced in commit cd8af3f8f1
as part of a change to log client IPv6 addresses (from
env["REMOTE_ADDR") without escaping the colons. However, cd8af3f8f1
also applied that to the logging of env["PATH_INFO"]. This seems
unhelpful since IPv6 addresses in URL paths are not particularly
common, so I've removed it. The change is backwards-compatible since a
double-unquote of the logged value will still return the original
PATH_INFO.

With that in mind, let's simplify further. req.path quotes
env["PATH_INFO"], so that cancels out one unquote() call, leaving us
with this:

    quote(req.path_info)

which produces basically the same result as before, but faster.

Change-Id: I7e665eb55a9524aa49e2578f2084d8354f6c1e31
'}]
commit_message:
Improve path handling in proxy_logging

In the access log, proxy_logging places the URL path,
double-URL-encoded (e.g. " " -> %20 -> %2520).

In the WSGI environment, env['PATH_INFO'] is the unquoted path sent by
the client, e.g. "/v1/a/c/o" or "/v1/a/c/obj with spaces" or
"/v1/a/c/u-\xf0\x9f\xa4\x94". On the request, we have the "path"
attribute, which returns the quoted form of env["PATH_INFO"].

Note that, under Python 2, these are always str objects, not unicode.

Swift used to log this:

    quote(quote(unquote(
        req.path.decode('utf-8', 'replace').encode('utf-8')), "/:"))

There's a lot going on here. Let's look at the innermost expression:

    req.path.decode('utf-8', 'replace').encode('utf-8')

This appears to be trying to replace invalid UTF-8 sequences with the
Unicode replacement character. However, since we start from
"req.path", which quotes its input, we don't have any non-ASCII bytes,
so the decode/encode is a no-op. That is, if env["PATH_INFO"] had
"\xff\xff" in it, req.path would have "%FF%FF", so there's no invalid
byte sequences to escape.

So, without changing the output, we can simplify the above code to:

    quote(quote(unquote(req.path), "/:"))

The second call to quote() has a second argument of "/:", so neither
slashes or colons are quoted. This was introduced in commit cd8af3f8f1
as part of a change to log client IPv6 addresses (from
env["REMOTE_ADDR") without escaping the colons. However, cd8af3f8f1
also applied that to the logging of env["PATH_INFO"]. This seems
unhelpful since IPv6 addresses in URL paths are not particularly
common, so I've removed it. The change is backwards-compatible since a
double-unquote of the logged value will still return the original
PATH_INFO.

With that in mind, let's simplify further. req.path quotes
env["PATH_INFO"], so that cancels out one unquote() call, leaving us
with this:

    quote(req.path_info)

which produces basically the same result as before, but faster.

Change-Id: I7e665eb55a9524aa49e2578f2084d8354f6c1e31

(4 comments)

In addition to fixing the inline stuff, I think it would be a good idea to add some checking (at least) to swift-ring-builder.

# swift-ring-builder composed.builder
Ring Builder file is invalid: composed.builder

If "-ring-builder" at least identified that it was a composite ring, it could give a better message. Or it could even call "-ring-composer show".'}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2017-06-20 10:24:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

(4 comments)

Thanks John

I'll propose another patch to make swift-ring-builder show hints about composite builder files. I'm a little wary of putting too much composite builder support into swift-ring-builder because we made a conscious decision to not *yet* support composite rings with swift-ring-builder (pending a decision about the right way forwards with the cli tools). If swift-ring-builder defaults to showing composite builder metadata, then the next obvious request could be for it to support the 'compose' command etc."}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2017-06-20 10:24:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2017-06-20 10:44:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-06-20 12:06:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Verified+1

More composter documentation would be nice. There is --help, but still took some getting used too.

I know it's only an experimental tool, so why bother. Well in case people want to play with the new feature. So I went and wrote some basic doc for it: http://paste.openstack.org/show/704141/

Which I'm happy to push up a new patch if kota or al don't mind.

Other then that, the tool could be better. have more checks, etc. but as it is it gives a simple interface into using the composite ring features for people to play with.

So I think this needs to land and happy to land it as it is.. as something is better then nothing. Especally as we've been telling people about composite rings, and atm if you really want to you have to do so programmatically... that bar IMHO is too high."}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2018-03-19 05:52:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 17.'}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2018-06-12 01:02:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17:

Shall we just merge this, as having a basic cli tool to work with composite rings is better then none?'}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2018-06-13 10:26:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 18.'}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2018-06-13 10:27:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 18: Code-Review+1

IMHO this is far from perfect but better than nothing. I tidied up the docstring a little.'}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2018-06-14 02:30:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 19.'}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2018-06-14 08:51:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 20.'}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2018-06-14 08:54:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 20: Code-Review+2

I'm primary author of this so not going to +A but there seems to be agreement that this could be merged and then improved [1].

[1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/swift/2018/swift.2018-06-13-21.00.log.html#l-98"}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2018-06-14 23:42:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 20: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Let's land it!"}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-03-29 18:13:56.000000000', 'message': "Experimental swift-ring-composer CLI to build composite rings

Provides a simple, experimental, CLI tool to generate a
composite ring from a list of component builder files. The
CLI has the form:

swift-ring-composer <composite-ring-file> <builder-file> <builder-file> ...

The composite ring file and all builder files provided on the command
line must be in the current working directory. This restriction is
imposed in order to guarantee that the builder 'source' attributes
stored inthe composite ring metadata will remain consistent between
execution of the command on the same file set.

Co-Authored-By: Kota Tsuyuzaki <tsuyuzaki.kota@lab.ntt.co.jp>
Change-Id: I25a79e71c13af352e19e4358f60545265b51584f
"}, {'created': '2017-03-30 10:34:07.000000000', 'message': "Experimental swift-ring-composer CLI to build composite rings

commit_message:
Experimental swift-ring-composer CLI to build composite rings

Provides a simple, experimental, CLI tool to generate a
composite ring from a list of component builder files.

For example:

  swift-ring-composer <composite-file> compose \
      <builder-file> <builder-file> --output <ring-file>

Commands available:

- compose: compose a list of builder file to a composite ring
- show: show the metadata for a composite ring

Co-Authored-By: Kota Tsuyuzaki <tsuyuzaki.kota@lab.ntt.co.jp>
Co-Authored-By: Matthew Oliver <matt@oliver.net.au>
Change-Id: I25a79e71c13af352e19e4358f60545265b51584f

commit_message:
[Stable Only] Initialise failed_builds in IronicNodeState

When we merged I71c56fe770f8c3f66db97fa542fdfdf2b9865fb8 we introduced a
regression in the ironic host manager as it doesn't setup a
failed_builds attribute.  We didn't need to do this on master as the
host manager in question is already removed due to
I695b250c82c8dcedcd8e2bee00c56bb2df19212c

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/575132/
Change-Id: Ia52dda42208398b4f719fa3023dd10d9642b1e02
Closes-Bug: 1776596

commit_message:
Add the migration script and ansible playbooks/roles to setup.cfg

We want the migration script to be in the PATH and also the playbooks
and roles for migration to be in /usr/share/networking-ovn/migration/.
Afterwards, we'll be creating a subpackage of networking-ovn in RDO
which will include all the necessary scripts and ansible bits so that
we can perform the migration from ML2/OVS to OVN.

Change-Id: Ide7874610fa2f831b6b7787850fa7a14417c5c62
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>

commit_message:
dev mode: Add support for cinder

Provide support for kolla dev mode in cinder. When
'kolla_dev_mode' or 'cinder_dev_mode' variables are
enabled, source code of cinder project is cloned
and bind mounted.

Partially implements: blueprint mount-sources

Change-Id: I9ccd395d076f9cc1ad4b51af9d22ba8b17fac1bc

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-14 20:20:21.000000000', 'message': 'Fix access control for single host addresses

In CIDR notation, the max prefix-length is typically
used to denote individual host addresses, for example:
2620:52:0:13b8::fe:e7 and 2620:52:0:13b8::fe:e7/128
are semantically the same.

Fix the access-allow API to raise 409 Conflict if
an address by either notation already exists in the
manila database for a given share.

Change-Id: I6e790fd0edd82064a3c5cda8a919c9eeb2da85d0
Closes-Bug: 1767430
'}, {'created': '2018-05-14 23:21:44.000000000', 'message': 'Fix access control for single host addresses

In CIDR notation, the max prefix-length is typically
used to denote individual host addresses, for example:
2620:52:0:13b8::fe:e7 and 2620:52:0:13b8::fe:e7/128
are semantically the same.

Fix the access-allow API to raise 400 Bad Request if
an address by either notation already exists in the
manila database for a given share.

Change-Id: I6e790fd0edd82064a3c5cda8a919c9eeb2da85d0
Closes-Bug: 1767430
'}]
commit_message:
Fix access control for single host addresses

In CIDR notation, the max prefix-length is typically
used to denote individual host addresses, for example:
2620:52:0:13b8::fe:e7 and 2620:52:0:13b8::fe:e7/128
are semantically the same.

Fix the access-allow API to raise 400 Bad Request if
an address by either notation already exists in the
manila database for a given share.

Change-Id: I6e790fd0edd82064a3c5cda8a919c9eeb2da85d0
Closes-Bug: 1767430

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

commit_message:
Add upgrade task options

To ensure users can upgrade packages the variable
`"{{ elk_package_state | default('present') }}"` has been added
to all package installs.

Change-Id: I0238d9e1ed991cb1480bd924f2d5a09687890da3
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
make requirements check job check for minimum version definitions.

While we don't track the minimum version of a given requirement in
requirements.txt we still need to ensure that they exist.

Change-Id: I84bfbc3a1db4032ee1a2b5995e6930978be42828
Closes-Bug: #1776247

commit_message:
DNM: test ironic scheduling with NUMATopologyFilter

Nova commit c99fc64271f41a028c75e96348813f673d04e245 suggested
that the NUMATopologyFilter won't work with baremetal instances
or nodes, so this is testing that out.

Change-Id: I392631c331dc941745c67860b5aba031a207a429

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-06 15:25:57.000000000', 'message': 'Respect selected region in multi-region clouds

The region name value provided via an environment variable or a command
line argument was not passed to the client object, meaning that the
wrong endpoint could be selected in a multi-region cloud.

Change-Id: Ia8bbec7e429d5a2385b7f38310512a93fbfb9ce1
'}]
commit_message:
Respect selected region in multi-region clouds

The region name value provided via an environment variable or a command
line argument was not passed to the client object, meaning that the
wrong endpoint could be selected in a multi-region cloud.

Change-Id: Ia8bbec7e429d5a2385b7f38310512a93fbfb9ce1

subject: Enable Python hash seed randomization in tests
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-05 13:52:25.000000000', 'message': 'Enable Python hash seed randomization in tests

Unit tests should run with hash seed randomization
on, to ensure code is not introduced that relies on
ordered access of dicts, sets, etc.

Python 3.3 enables this at runtime by default.

Change-Id: I094954a989be9fd608204a0e42a471aef3d02696
'}]
commit_message:
Enable Python hash seed randomization in tests

Unit tests should run with hash seed randomization
on, to ensure code is not introduced that relies on
ordered access of dicts, sets, etc.

Python 3.3 enables this at runtime by default.

Change-Id: I094954a989be9fd608204a0e42a471aef3d02696

commit_message:
Fix input import to work with py2 and py3

While running the kolla-cli in the kolla-ansible CI, it failed with this
error:

Traceback (most recent call last):
...
File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/kolla_cli/commands/host.py",
line 23, in <module>
    from builtins import input
ImportError: No module named builtins

The fix is to use six in the import

Change-Id: Id3a0ab13b659e8b8f4ee0b90c11cd8d5ede3644b

subject: Install upstream NGINX repository
messages:
[{'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2018-06-14 00:50:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2018-06-14 02:27:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2018-06-14 11:57:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

It might be better to only allow nginx packages from this repo to ensure that nothing else gets installed that might conflict with other repos.

Moreover,  another external repo leads to decreased stability in the gates since we often see network/timeout issues when downloading things from external resources. The benefit from the EPEL repo is that  it's mirrored in the openstack infra which means gates are generally more stable when they use it."}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-06-14 17:31:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

looks good to me.'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-06-14 17:31:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-06-14 17:32:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 13095, 'date': '2018-06-14 20:04:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

for dropping EPEL !'}, {'account_id': 13095, 'date': '2018-06-14 20:05:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}]

commit_message:
Install upstream NGINX repository

As we are no longer using EPEL, we pull nginx directly from
upstream.

Change-Id: I95db0a59bb825c82303e36bc8f314dd31a933408

commit_message:
Replace deprecated alias 'os' with 'os_primary'

Tempest has deprecated the alias 'os' and will use the alias 'os_primary'
instead. The alias 'os' was deprecated in Pike and planned to be removed
in Queen.

Let's use the stable alias 'os_primary' for primary credential. This will
help Tempest to remove the deprecated alias 'os'.

according this Id: I9f7c13da05a8c4a63529c11aa6213a7269abee6d

Change-Id: Ib5cbeb221da5da3ddda99dc5e33494ee64b763a1

commit_message:
Drop old README file

This patchset drops an old README file (not the main README file)
that contains no content. If we want to include README content
under patrole_tempest_plugin package we can do so later, but we
should not keep an empty documentation page around for nothing.

Change-Id: I7e524e849a02732e70c5109795f422ac7f7cba25

commit_message:
Add delete action for images

This patch adds delete action for images panel.
Delete action needs to specify "host" parameter,
so this action is implemeted as item action.

Change-Id: I722d2859785ead7175a63d72ab42e1a9e33197ed

commit_message:
Add "host" parameter for image pull

Also, this patch marks "repo" and "host" as "required".

This patch implements pull-down input for specifying host.
To compose the pull-down, this patch imlements
REST API and Angular service for retrieving host list.

Change-Id: Iba8f440f6d8339e1353bb64c26c25a493c874f63
Implements: blueprint image-host

subject: tox: Don't delete Python3 .pyc files
messages: [{'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-03-29 01:37:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7385, 'date': '2018-04-27 09:40:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-06-14 23:38:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-29 01:37:33.000000000', 'message': "tox: Don't delete Python3 .pyc files

Python3 is smarter than Python2 about when to make use of .pyc files, so
there's no need to remove them before running unit tests just in case the
developer has switched branches.[1] To save recompiling before every test
run, disable this behaviour for Python3.

Also, use a consistent find command in all of the environments where we do
this.

[1] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3147/#case-3-pycache-foo-magic-pyc-with-no-source

Change-Id: Iabaa4a697329e7538fab93541f41fc208e591382
"}]
commit_message:
tox: Don't delete Python3 .pyc files

Python3 is smarter than Python2 about when to make use of .pyc files, so
there's no need to remove them before running unit tests just in case the
developer has switched branches.[1] To save recompiling before every test
run, disable this behaviour for Python3.

Also, use a consistent find command in all of the environments where we do
this.

[1] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3147/#case-3-pycache-foo-magic-pyc-with-no-source

Change-Id: Iabaa4a697329e7538fab93541f41fc208e591382

commit_message:
Docs: include all useful module docs

The list of modules to exclude from autodoc was set some time back, and
is pretty arbitrary looking. Lots of modules that would be useful to a
Heat developer to see documented (e.g. all of heat.common, heat.db) were
not documented, while some other fairly useless ones were.

Change-Id: Ie3aa5bbe8deb8d07eef5fcc352e349a1fa7c68bc

commit_message:
Replace pbr autodoc with sphinxcontrib-apidoc

This fixes local building of the documentation using tox, and allows the
gate to stop relying on pbr and move completely to the new docs PTI.

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128594.html

Change-Id: I6ef3e102f5a169262efbbaeec61452f0a2443fb4
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/560577

[{'created': '2018-06-12 18:36:35.000000000', 'message': 'Gate fix: Cap nova-network tests at Queens

Nova is working on removing the nova-network only
compute REST APIs in the Rocky release, which means
any requests to those APIs after Queens will result
in a 410 response, regardless of microversion or
whether or not neutron is being used.

The os-virtual-interfaces API is being removed in
nova change: https://review.openstack.org/569923/

As a result, os-virtual-interfaces tests will no longer
works against Rocky+ versions of nova.

nova-network tests are skipped by adding
`depends_on_nova_network = True` to the test class. The
base compute API class does a check to determine, based
on the max compute API microversion, which release is
being tested and if Rocky+ the nova-network specific
tests will be skipped.

Subsequent nova-network specific tests will be skipped
as the API removal changes are proposed in nova.

Related to blueprint remove-nova-network

Change-Id: I1d8d9aba6f44ee451e8e4d93a3e5bf5e70f7bbb3

commit_message:
Gate fix: Cap nova-network tests at Queens

Nova is working on removing the nova-network only
compute REST APIs in the Rocky release, which means
any requests to those APIs after Queens will result
in a 410 response, regardless of microversion or
whether or not neutron is being used.

The os-virtual-interfaces API is being removed in
nova change: https://review.openstack.org/569923/

As a result, os-virtual-interfaces tests will no longer
works against Rocky+ versions of nova.

nova-network tests are skipped by adding
`depends_on_nova_network = True` to the test class. The
base compute API class does a check to determine, based
on the max compute API microversion, which release is
being tested and if Rocky+ the nova-network specific
tests will be skipped.

Subsequent nova-network specific tests will be skipped
as the API removal changes are proposed in nova.

Related to blueprint remove-nova-network

Change-Id: I1d8d9aba6f44ee451e8e4d93a3e5bf5e70f7bbb3

commit_message:
k8s_fedora: enable tls in traefik ingress

Add explicit entrypoints to the traefik controller configuration, with
the existing http but also adding a tls enable entrypoint on port 443.

Add corresponding ports to service and container definitions.

Story: 2002555
Task: 22117

Change-Id: I3413947276019b584db15a92f62a1a427ac26594

commit_message:
Fix logo in IE11/Edge browsers

IE11/Edge browsers doesn't scale SVG images correct if
weight and height is specified directly in SVG. Also these
browsers doesn't work well with max-height style.

Change-Id: I3fe643dd5e0d47cb0e5a658c84d23a8750c217e7
Closes-Bug: #1715674

bandit to the pep8 gate to automatically lint for security issues

commit_message:
Add bandit to pep8 gate

Neutron uses bandit to detect security issues. This patch adds
bandit to the pep8 gate to automatically lint for security issues
in neutron-lib.

Fixed two B101 errors it spotted.

Change-Id: I39d713d0d230b5ae759daa6bc1be9794e6fe2a32

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-12 19:46:16.000000000', 'message': 'Use elasticsearch cordonator nodes as smark LBs

Elasticsearch can be used as a smart load balancer for all traffic
which will remove the requirement for a VIP and move the cluster to a
mesh topology. All of the Kibana nodes will now run elasticsearch as
cordonator.

* Kibana will now connect to elasticsearch on localhost.
* All of the beats have been setup to use use the new mesh topology.

More on node assigments can be found here:
* https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/6.2/modules-node.html#modules-node

Change-Id: I769e0251072f5dbde56fcce7753236d37d5c3b19
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Use elasticsearch coordinator nodes as smart LBs

Elasticsearch can be used as a smart load balancer for all traffic
which will remove the requirement for a VIP and move the cluster to a
mesh topology. All of the Kibana nodes will now run elasticsearch as
cordonator.

* Kibana will now connect to elasticsearch on localhost.
* All of the beats have been setup to use use the new mesh topology.
* jvm memory management has been updated to reflect the additional
  services.

More on node assigments can be found here:
* https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/6.2/modules-node.html#modules-node

* The readme has been updated to reflect these changes.

Change-Id: I769e0251072f5dbde56fcce7753236d37d5c3b19
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not

Change-Id: I9abfcb14c06a6a9d31e9f53278dd11eccdef488d

Change-Id: I9abfcb14c06a6a9d31e9f53278dd11eccdef488d

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We can't set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36 due to https://github.com/tox-dev/tox/issues/425

Change-Id: I9abfcb14c06a6a9d31e9f53278dd11eccdef488d

subject: Fix race condition issue for k8s  multi masters
messages: [{'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2018-06-14 17:07:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2018-06-14 17:55:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2018-06-14 21:42:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-14 17:07:27.000000000', 'message': "Fix race condition issue for k8s  multi masters

When creating a multi-master cluster, all master nodes will attempt to
create kubernetes resources in the cluster at this same time, like
coredns, the dashboard, calico etc. This race conditon shouldn't be
a problem when doing declarative calls instead of imperative (kubectl
apply instead of create). However, due to [1], kubectl fails to apply
the changes and the deployemnt scripts fail causing cluster to creation
to fail in the case of Heat SoftwareDeployments. This patch passes the
ResourceGroup index of every master so that resource creation will be
attempted only from the first master node.

[1] https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/44165

Task: 21673
Story: 1775759

Change-Id: I83f78022481aeef945334c37ac6c812bba9791fd
(cherry picked from commit 3c72d7b88b6c41d2a85a71c438018313d6169f7f)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix race condition issue for k8s  multi masters

When creating a multi-master cluster, all master nodes will attempt to
create kubernetes resources in the cluster at this same time, like
coredns, the dashboard, calico etc. This race conditon shouldn't be
a problem when doing declarative calls instead of imperative (kubectl
apply instead of create). However, due to [1], kubectl fails to apply
the changes and the deployemnt scripts fail causing cluster to creation
to fail in the case of Heat SoftwareDeployments. This patch passes the
ResourceGroup index of every master so that resource creation will be
attempted only from the first master node.

[1] https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/44165

Task: 21673
Story: 1775759

Change-Id: I83f78022481aeef945334c37ac6c812bba9791fd
(cherry picked from commit 3c72d7b88b6c41d2a85a71c438018313d6169f7f)

subject: tox: Don't set basepython in testenv
messages: [{'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2018-05-30 14:07:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-05-30 16:27:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-06-14 20:42:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-30 14:07:50.000000000', 'message': "tox: Don't set basepython in testenv

Turns out doing this overrides the basepython for every 'py{version}'
implicit target, meaning py35, py36 etc. will use the same Python 3.x
version. We don't want that so set basepython manually.

This will hopefully be a non-issue when the gate bumps to Bionic.

Change-Id: I8d47f9ede4e9d1d221f6643135407ad2d5cea282
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
tox: Don't set basepython in testenv

Turns out doing this overrides the basepython for every 'py{version}'
implicit target, meaning py35, py36 etc. will use the same Python 3.x
version. We don't want that so set basepython manually.

This will hopefully be a non-issue when the gate bumps to Bionic.

Change-Id: I8d47f9ede4e9d1d221f6643135407ad2d5cea282
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add task to install requirements and change pathing

To run the curator playbook pip is required. This change installs the
package `python-virtualenv` to resolve the dependency and installs the
curator application into a virtualenv within /opt. This will keep the
host clean by isolating the dependencies and ensure that we can easily
clean up should we ever need to.

Change-Id: If872bb30281948d79a3f79a0e3a39e8a457c6fdb
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

subject: Fix exception with secretutils
messages: [{'account_id': 26948, 'date': '2018-05-23 09:27:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 26948, 'date': '2018-05-24 02:43:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 26948, 'date': '2018-05-24 03:57:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 26948, 'date': '2018-05-24 10:55:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-06-14 19:53:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-06-14 20:30:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-23 09:27:46.000000000', 'message': "Fixed two issues with secretutils

1. There are some problems with the test method.
 problem 1:
  Unit tests may not cover our function, it depends on the python version
  that performed the test.
 problem 2:
  when using function 'constant_time_compare(first, second)', 'first' and
  'second' params are usually HMAC digest values, it is not appropriate to
  use utf-8 encoded values as mock data.

2. The previous commit `f1d332a` lead into a bug, but due to the problem 1
   and the problem 2, we did not find out the error.

Change-Id: I1c29bfe69f8eda60f3c5caaf3e5447dd5b69b108
Closes-Bug: #1772851
"}, {'created': '2018-05-24 02:43:11.000000000', 'message': "Fix exception with secretutils

1. There are some problems about the test method.
 problem 1:
  Unit tests may not cover our function, it depends on the python version
  that performed the test.
 problem 2:
  when using function 'constant_time_compare(first, second)', 'first' and
  'second' params are usually HMAC digest values, it is not appropriate to
  use utf-8 encoded values as mock data.

2. The previous commit `f1d332a` lead into a bug, but due to the problem 1
   and the problem 2, we did not find out the error.

Change-Id: I1c29bfe69f8eda60f3c5caaf3e5447dd5b69b108
Closes-Bug: #1772851

commit_message:
Fix exception with secretutils

1. There are some problems about the test method.
 problem 1:
  Unit tests may not cover our function, it depends on the python version
  that performed the test.
 problem 2:
  when using function 'constant_time_compare(first, second)', 'first' and
  'second' params are usually HMAC digest values, it is not appropriate to
  use utf-8 encoded values as mock data.

2. The previous commit `f1d332a` lead into a bug, but due to the problem 1
   and the problem 2, we did not find out the error.

Change-Id: I1c29bfe69f8eda60f3c5caaf3e5447dd5b69b108
Closes-Bug: #1772851

commit_message:
Clean output of driver list generation

The driver list generation takes driver docstrings and attempts
to parse that into rst formatted output for publication. With the
way this content is formatted within the docstring, this would
cause some slightly off formatting in the html output.

This attempts to better extract that information to make the
output cleaner and more readable.

Change-Id: I3b7e0817ade1c86b6d157c96872f00bb1b99c3d8

commit_message:
Support same projects in different domain

Getting 500 error when there are same project name
in different domain.
Selecting one domain from service_credentials.
e.g. services(or service) projects are in default and service_domain
having differrent id. so this selects default's services project
instead of service_domain's services project

Closes-Bug: #1776375
Change-Id: Ibb79423a06062f2e00785c30f54e7ac2a41a4705

[{'created': '2018-06-06 20:06:26.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I0db7cdc38ed8392ec4358467115b6d715c71bb29
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that

Change-Id: I0db7cdc38ed8392ec4358467115b6d715c71bb29
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I0db7cdc38ed8392ec4358467115b6d715c71bb29
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
After tempest network resource do not be cleared

When use multitenancy_enabled, mybe create net, subnet and router resources,
be used to create share network, after run the tempest those network resource
do not be cleared in the end of tempest.

Change-Id: I2827485a78ad001eb49b7fc583b15f47662b853a
Closes-Bug:#1755467
