'}, {'created': '2018-04-25 13:56:50.000000000', 'message': 'Init placement before nova

With change I7e1e89cd66397883453935dcf7172d977bf82e84 the placement
service may optionally use its own database. In order for this to
work, however, the ordering of how both nova and placement are
configured and initialized in stack.sh requires careful control.

* nova.conf must be created first
* then placement must make some adjustments to it
* then lib/placement needs to create the placement database
* before nova does a database sync (of both databases)

Otherwise, when the placement_database/connection is defined, the nova
db_sync command will fail because the placement database does not yet
exist. If we try to do a sync before the nova_api database is created
_that_ sync will fail.

This patch adjusts the ordering and also removes a comment that will
no longer be true when I7e1e89cd66397883453935dcf7172d977bf82e84 is
merged.

Change-Id: Id5b5911c04d198fe7b94c7d827afeb5cdf43a076
'}]
commit_message:
Init placement before nova

With change I7e1e89cd66397883453935dcf7172d977bf82e84 the placement
service may optionally use its own database. In order for this to
work, however, the ordering of how both nova and placement are
configured and initialized in stack.sh requires careful control.

* nova.conf must be created first
* then placement must make some adjustments to it
* then lib/placement needs to create the placement database
* before nova does a database sync (of both databases)

Otherwise, when the placement_database/connection is defined, the nova
db_sync command will fail because the placement database does not yet
exist. If we try to do a sync before the nova_api database is created
_that_ sync will fail.

This patch adjusts the ordering and also removes a comment that will
no longer be true when I7e1e89cd66397883453935dcf7172d977bf82e84 is
merged.

Change-Id: Id5b5911c04d198fe7b94c7d827afeb5cdf43a076

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-14 20:00:32.000000000', 'message': 'Extract part of PlacementFixture to placement

In nova.tests.fixtures is a PlacementFixture that peforms two roles. One
is to provide a working placement service via wsgi-intercept. The other
is to provide a working client of that service in the form of a
scheduler report client that uses appropriate headers and endpoints.

This change extracts the first role to a new fixture hosted within the
placement hierarchy and makes the second role a subclass of the first.

To make this work nicely, existing placement fixtures (in fixtures.py),
used solely for the gabbi tests are moved into a new directly called
"fixtures" and renamed to "gabbits.py".

This is a small part of ongoing work related to
blueprint bp/placement-extract

To make this work nicely, existing placement fixtures (in fixtures.py),
used solely for the gabbi tests are moved into a new directory called
"fixtures" and renamed to "gabbits.py". "gabbi.py" can't be used

commit_message:
Extract part of PlacementFixture to placement

In nova.tests.fixtures is a PlacementFixture that peforms two roles. One
is to provide a working placement service via wsgi-intercept. The other
is to provide a working client of that service in the form of a
scheduler report client that uses appropriate headers and endpoints.

This change extracts the first role to a new fixture hosted within the
placement hierarchy and makes the second role a subclass of the first.

To make this work nicely, existing placement fixtures (in fixtures.py),
used solely for the gabbi tests are moved into a new directory called
"fixtures" and renamed to "gabbits.py". "gabbi.py" can't be used
because of naming conflicts while importing.

This is a small part of ongoing work related to
blueprint placement-extract

Change-Id: I126ada549d3879f89d1ec64b743da14807a39351

commit_message:
Create an additional network interface on subnode

For standalone reproducing we need another interface (eth1) on the
subnode. Add it to heat template of subnode.

Change-Id: I9617dafff83f800ed75b4478c7040301b0c944a1

commit_message:
Convert Keystone to use Flask

Basic conversion of Keystone's core application to flask framework.

This doesn't add much in the way of flask-specific-isms but should
get keystone running directly under flask. This implementation does
not use paste-deploy.

Change-Id: Ib4c1ed3f645dd55fbfb76395263ecdaf605caae7

commit_message:
storage: hide useless logs

Logging the sqlalchemy DuplicateEntry error message on each event
is useless. And people may though it's an error.

This change moves the log level to debug.

Change-Id: I86b64e5cf370386dab6f962b09029feeb35a9dbf
(cherry picked from commit 61ae4a2cd304b76a4383725b4db4065c8f3b544f)

commit_message:
Support bluestore deployment at kolla-ansible

The new process supports the deployment of bluestore osd, and updates
the filestore initialization script, but doesn't change the filestore
deployment and startup process.

Change-Id: I8e17bec76f006bc25faac51ca5a03b8be4ba2eb7

commit_message:
No need to double encode the key name, since Lock.acquire() client.key()
and most other methods already encode the key name.

Change-Id: Id2f56b124a7236253a6d8eebde16c1ed171c68fa

commit_message:
Enable secure TUNNELLED mode for NFS

This is the follow up patch for change
Ie4fe217bd119b638f42c682d21572547f02f17b2 which allows
configuring NFS backend for Nova.

To provide enhanced security improvement for migration, this
change enables TUNNELLED mode for migration, in case of
NFS shared storage.

Change-Id: Id0cfc945814e6aa5a5c85643514cf206f42e50f4
Implements: bp tripleo-nova-nfs

commit_message:
Add timestamps to update log files

In order for logstash indexing to function, logfiles need timestamps

This commit "updates the update logs" to be consistent with other
logs collected by CI. Note that the timestamper_cmd has an embedded "|"

Related Change (upgrade logging):

- https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/tripleo-upgrade/commit/?id=baff4a25229b1904e960e426208eca76c96c3ab4

Change-Id: I47b6ff912aa045c266b903fa148b068be653cae2

commit_message:
Fix overcloud delete command

In change I6d41f74f9271c17bcae67eb3c09460051f55667f we changed the
signature of delete_deployment_plan from:
def delete_deployment_plan(workflow_client, **input_)

to:
def delete_deployment_plan(clients, **workflow_input)

In that change we did adjust tripleoclient/v1/overcloud_plan.py
but we forgot the overcloud delete.

We need to make sure we pass the clients and not the workflow_engine
itself when we invoke the function in tripleoclient.

Tested-By: Raoul Scarazzini <rscarazz@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I88642f5d60be629de90312523a3a9c5ea1e4fd63
Closes-Bug: #1776313

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-11 12:11:49.000000000', 'message': 'Updates: run host_prep_tasks between update tasks and deployment tasks

We should re-run host_prep_tasks as part of the minor update, to make
sure the host is ready for starting the updated containers. The right
place for them is between update tasks and deployment tasks.

This is important in case we deliver changes to host_prep_tasks during
minor update, or if update_tasks do something that would partially
undo the host preparation, e.g. clear/delete some directories on the
host to get rid of previous state.

Change-Id: Ic0a905a8c4691cbe75113131bd84e8a39dea046d
Related-Bug: #1776206
'}]
commit_message:
Updates: run host_prep_tasks between update tasks and deployment tasks

We should re-run host_prep_tasks as part of the minor update, to make
sure the host is ready for starting the updated containers. The right
place for them is between update tasks and deployment tasks.

This is important in case we deliver changes to host_prep_tasks during
minor update, or if update_tasks do something that would partially
undo the host preparation, e.g. clear/delete some directories on the
host to get rid of previous state.

Change-Id: Ic0a905a8c4691cbe75113131bd84e8a39dea046d
Related-Bug: #1776206

commit_message:
Upgrades: Refactor playbooks to set facts

To not to redefine variable multiple times in each service we
run check only once and we set fact. To increase readability of
generated playbook we add block per strep in services.

Change-Id: I2399a72709d240f84e3463c5c3b56942462d1e5c

[{'created': '2018-05-14 20:52:40.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Add unqiue constraint to service_statuses

Change-Id: I307a8f7dd8b8a83effa447a846db3288efa32dba
'}, {'created': '2018-05-14 22:11:45.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Add unqiue constraint to service_statuses

Change-Id: I307a8f7dd8b8a83effa447a846db3288efa32dba
'}, {'created': '2018-05-15 05:58:08.000000000', 'message': "Add unqiue constraint to service_statuses

This patch adds a unique constraint to the service_statuses
table based on the service_name and hostname, to make sure
that there can't be a duplicate service entry.

In addition we add a new log line that highlights when a new
service entry is added.

Change-Id: I307a8f7dd8b8a83effa447a846db3288efa32dba
Closes-Bug: #1768824
"}, {'created': '2018-05-15 05:58:44.000000000', 'message': "Add unqiue constraint to service_statuses

This patch adds a unique constraint to the service_statuses
table based on the service_name and hostname, to make sure
that there can't be a duplicate service entry.

In addition we add a new log line that highlights when a new
service entry is added.

Change-Id: I307a8f7dd8b8a83effa447a846db3288efa32dba
Closes-Bug: #1768824
"}, {'created': '2018-05-15 06:00:05.000000000', 'message': "Add unqiue constraint to service_statuses

This patch adds a unique constraint to the service_statuses
table based on the service_name and hostname, to make sure
that there can't be a duplicate service entry.

In addition we add a new log line that highlights when a new
service entry is added.

Change-Id: I307a8f7dd8b8a83effa447a846db3288efa32dba
Closes-Bug: #1768824
"}, {'created': '2018-05-16 05:08:44.000000000', 'message': 'Add unqiue constraint to service_statuses

In the current implementation, if for any reason a duplicate
service entry gets created, the call to update that service
will fail endlessly, and instead cause the service to create
new entries everytime update_service_status gets called. Causing
it to fill the database with duplicate entries.

This patch adds a unique constraint to the service_statuses
table based on the service_name and hostname, to ensure that
this cannot happen.

In addition we add unit-tests to the storage driver, and
further expands the update_service_status tests coverage.

Change-Id: I307a8f7dd8b8a83effa447a846db3288efa32dba
Closes-Bug: #1768824
'}, {'created': '2018-05-16 05:22:14.000000000', 'message': 'Add unqiue constraint to service_statuses

In the current implementation, if for any reason a duplicate
service entry gets created, the call to update that service
will fail endlessly, and instead cause the service to create
new entries everytime update_service_status gets called. Causing
it to fill the database with duplicate entries.

This patch adds a unique constraint to the service_statuses
table based on the service_name and hostname, to ensure that
this cannot happen.

In addition we add a new test to the storage driver and further
expanded the central service test coverage.

Change-Id: I307a8f7dd8b8a83effa447a846db3288efa32dba
Closes-Bug: #1768824
'}, {'created': '2018-05-16 23:09:27.000000000', 'message': 'Add unique constraint to service_statuses

In the current implementation, if for any reason a duplicate
service entry gets created, the call to update that service
will fail endlessly, and instead cause the service to create
new entries everytime update_service_status gets called. Causing
it to fill the database with duplicate entries.

This patch adds a unique constraint to the service_statuses
table based on the service_name and hostname, to ensure that
this cannot happen.

In addition we add a new test to the storage driver and further
expanded the central service test coverage.

Change-Id: I307a8f7dd8b8a83effa447a846db3288efa32dba

commit_message:
Add unique constraint to service_statuses

In the current implementation, if for any reason a duplicate
service entry gets created, the call to update that service
will fail endlessly, and instead cause the service to create
new entries everytime update_service_status gets called. Causing
it to fill the database with duplicate entries.

This patch adds a unique constraint to the service_statuses
table based on the service_name and hostname, to ensure that
this cannot happen.

In addition we add a new test to the storage driver and further
expanded the central service test coverage.

Change-Id: I307a8f7dd8b8a83effa447a846db3288efa32dba
Closes-Bug: #1768824

commit_message:
Handle renaming of Cinder VNX backend parameter

In I415eee7ddc601d1706a5d7f2a561e11b642fa826 the 'storage_vnx_pool_name'
parameter was essentially renamed to 'storage_vnx_pool_names'. This patch
adds support for the new name, and accepts the old name so current THT
continue work.

Related-Bug: #1775375
Depends-On: I415eee7ddc601d1706a5d7f2a561e11b642fa826
Change-Id: Ia48bbb88f6bc8180bfb6981813333eee70db79bb
(cherry picked from commit aa9d35e867e8be33960ebdff93b713670219a1e4)

commit_message:
HA overcloud: wait for db before running grant commands

When using the pacemaker profile, some collectors ensure that
mysql is up before trying to create databases or users.
Extend the ordering constraints to include grant operations.

Change-Id: Ib2af5dfe5af5a1f0db806c04ee83ed48724673db
Co-Authored-By: Michele Baldessari <michele@acksyn.org>
Closes-bug: #1776485

commit_message:
Handle renaming of Cinder VNX backend parameter

In I415eee7ddc601d1706a5d7f2a561e11b642fa826 the 'storage_vnx_pool_name'
parameter was essentially renamed to 'storage_vnx_pool_names'. This patch
adds support for the new name, and accepts the old name so current THT
continue work.

Related-Bug: #1775375
Depends-On: I415eee7ddc601d1706a5d7f2a561e11b642fa826
Change-Id: Ia48bbb88f6bc8180bfb6981813333eee70db79bb

commit_message:
zuul.d: jobs: Trigger functional jobs on tox.ini changes

The tox.ini file is the main driving force behind our tests. As such,
when we modify it we need to make sure that functional jobs are still
green.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/574382/
Change-Id: I4750e4f20d8992db279451a5b47907dab9a43b3f

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-14 15:43:04.000000000', 'message': "Make osc plugin work again

while moving to SessionClient the OSC plugin
was forgotten to be amended accordingly.

Besides, the keystoneauth Adapter's request method
returns a single response object, not a tuple.

This commit also updates relevant requirements to be
in sync with global OpenStack ones.

Change-Id: I1cd33feec81bafad6237ca72b9c2f410237898b4
Closes-Bug: #1747718
"}]
commit_message:
Make osc plugin work again

while moving to SessionClient the OSC plugin
was forgotten to be amended accordingly.

Besides, the keystoneauth Adapter's request method
returns a single response object, not a tuple.

This commit also updates relevant requirements to be
in sync with global OpenStack ones.

Change-Id: I1cd33feec81bafad6237ca72b9c2f410237898b4
Closes-Bug: #1747718

commit_message:
Add NexentaEdge drivers

NexentaEdge drivers were kicked from OpenStack pike release due to CI failures.
This patch implements NexentaEdge iSCSI drivers.

Change-Id: I1a2dd99fab742f7ad4d9aa470652bb5decb35359
Implements: blueprint nexentaedge-driver

commit_message:
Changes Delete Plan to Call Workflow

This patch updates the code and associated tests to change the
from directly calling the tripleo.plan.delete action to calling
the tripleo.plan_management.v1.delete_deployment_plan workflow.

Change-Id: I6d41f74f9271c17bcae67eb3c09460051f55667f
Depends-On: Ibaf3ee800de56309e014be53e698affc358c9f5a
Partial-Bug: 1640436

commit_message:
Add python3 django 1.11 job instead of django 2.0 job

Django 2.0 is now used in tox py35 job, so there is no need for
py35dj20 job. Instead, Django 1.11 with python3 is not covered.

- py35dj20 job is dropped from tox.ini.
- python3-django111 is added to tox.ini.
  python3 is specified to basepython to avoid a specific python version.
- .zuul.yaml is updated to consume horizon-openstack-tox-python3-django111
  and drop horizon-openstack-tox-py35dj20.

Change-Id: Ia83f6d4b99aaefdcec355862cfb5e94f6bf534d3

commit_message:
Move ansible to virtualenv in kolla_toolbox

Now the ansible and its python dependencies are installed on system. It
may be failed to install in some case. This patch installs python
packages in virtualenv for kolla_toolbox image.

Closes-Bug: #1771717
Change-Id: I3c4465d5dfe4f909521fa00173f1cf8d9eec783f
(cherry picked from commit ce31fa4b1c85de4c21ffb63f3cf58e02bfd3d0a4)

commit_message:
Document --record instead of --records

Per the cli, --records is deprecated and --record should be used
instead.

Change-Id: I00f2562342480a1eb9bdbba519e28c69dffe6d0e

[{'created': '2018-06-12 11:11:30.000000000', 'message': 'tasks: lxc_volume: Always create the machines.raw file

If the 'machinectl set-limit' command returns non-zero exit code
then the truncate command will be executed on the machines.raw file.
However, nothing creates the file up to that point so it fails like
this:

fatal: [localhost]: FAILED! => {"changed": false, "msg": "Device /var/lib/machines.raw not found."}

Change-Id: I8bfd8f2c698241d7b62d01f1674aff8e5c3d2eeb

The machines.raw file is only created if the 'machinectl set-limit'

commit_message:
tasks: lxc_volume: Always create the machines.raw file

The machines.raw file is only created if the 'machinectl set-limit'
command returns non-zero exit code. However, this file is expected to
be present later on so we need to make sure that we create without
taking the 'machinectl' exit code into consideration.

Fixes the following problem:

fatal: [localhost]: FAILED! => {"changed": false, "msg": "Device /var/lib/machines.raw not found."}

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/574382/
Change-Id: I8bfd8f2c698241d7b62d01f1674aff8e5c3d2eeb

'}, {'created': '2018-04-03 15:47:52.000000000', 'message': 'Build of Fedora Atomic 27 image using DIB 2.12.2

Disk Image Builder was failing to build Fedora Atomic 27 image due to a
number of issues. First, due to a change in the structure of
FEDORA_ATOMIC_TREE_REF for versions greater than 25. It was also failing
due to broken reference to DIB_IMAGE_ROOT_FS_UUID. Passing enforcing=0
as an argument to ostree-admin-deploy --karg= also does not seem to have
an effect thereofore selinux=1 and enforcing=0 are now configured as
arguments to the linux kernel on 15_ostree grub config. Final cause of
failure was also linked to the way ostree initialises repositories. It
uses to automatically create the default folder under /ostree/repo but
now, it has to be created explicitly before initialising the repository.

Closes-Bug: #1699735

Change-Id: If77066d6167eef835abb3d98827882f59e0c6295

commit_message:
Build of Fedora Atomic 27 image using DIB 2.12.2

Disk Image Builder was failing to build Fedora Atomic 27 image due to a
number of issues. First, due to a change in the structure of
FEDORA_ATOMIC_TREE_REF for versions greater than 25. It was also failing
due to broken reference to DIB_IMAGE_ROOT_FS_UUID. Passing enforcing=0
as an argument to ostree-admin-deploy --karg= also does not seem to have
an effect thereofore selinux=1 and enforcing=0 are now configured as
arguments to the linux kernel on 15_ostree grub config. Final cause of
failure was also linked to the way ostree initialises repositories. It
might have been automatically creating the default folder /ostree/repo
but now, it appears as though it has to be created explicitly before
initialising the repository.

Closes-Bug: #1699735

Change-Id: If77066d6167eef835abb3d98827882f59e0c6295

commit_message:
trivial: Add min_version: 3.1 to api_ref for upload volume

This patchset adds min_version: 3.1 to protected and
visiblity params which were added to upload volume to
image action in microversion 3.1 [0][1][2].

[0] https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/7d95fb79c42bdeeb82900b41acc70dead8a2ee6f/cinder/api/schemas/volume_actions.py#L150
[1] https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/master/cinder/api/contrib/volume_actions.py#L232
[2] https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/7d95fb79c42bdeeb82900b41acc70dead8a2ee6f/cinder/api/microversions.py#L42

Change-Id: Ibdfa086d9bdadd11263b0a71aa3fff65faddb32d

commit_message:
Replace deprecated nova calls for floatingip

This is a backport of 2 commits squashed into one to fix the gate.

1. Replaces the deprecated nova api calls for
add_floatingip/remove_floatingip. Nova api microversion > 2.43
does not support it.

2. Removes deprecated nova api calls from EIP/EIPAssociation

Change-Id: I3e6c9f56b84934a937a2275acd58fd9891a00e75
(cherry picked from commit f064206916faa3f7b3308d36746151ad105e3bf6 and
cherry picked from commit 6ea991f26a9735038624d00381b6623245e27fae)

commit_message:
Use correct variable for sso_callback_template deployment

The sso_callback_template file needs to be deployed for a
Keystone SP, not IDP. This patch fixes the conditional.

Closes-Bug: #1772772
Change-Id: I420e291807434382b4d3cd4c8809c7540a419f5a

commit_message:
VMware: Add file open mode to support python3

Python 3 opens file in text mode by default while Python 2 opens file
in binary mode by default. Adding mode explicitly to work for both
Python 2 and 3.

Closes-bug: 1775678
Change-Id: I1efffb84338e27c92957c7cc5a5f46fda9eda824

commit_message:
Check for ceph.conf instead of package

Rather than looking for a package to be installed,
this change lets us look for the ceph.conf that is
setup by the charm to determine if the charm has moved
past its install hook

Change-Id: I2b6cfbe0bb4207733ed991f6d3a9850584e30408

charm-recheck-full'}, {'account_id': 13686, 'date': '2018-04-14 22:25:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4: Patch Set 3 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 13686, 'date': '2018-04-14 22:42:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

charm-recheck-full'}, {'account_id': 11805, 'date': '2018-04-17 18:07:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)

I just took a short glance at this. I don't feel comfortable being the only reviewer on this so I think someone with better knowledge of how keystone handles SSL should have a look as well. Maybe thedac. A few general comments:

The commit says it closes https://bugs.launchpad.net/charm-keystone/+bug/1755897, but I'm not seeing an explanation of how it fixes it. Can you update the bug or commit to explain?

The commit says it's a related fix for https://bugs.launchpad.net/charm-keystone/+bug/1744990, but that bug is marked as Won't Fix, which seems confusing.

It seems there's more to this commit than just deprecating management of self-signed SSL certificates. Since that's the case I think this should be split into at least 2 different reviews/commits."}, {'account_id': 13686, 'date': '2018-04-18 00:02:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)

Thank you for your review, Corey.

This was very helpful in pointing out that part of the work that lead to this outcome has happened in a bubble and that better documentation of findings is in order.

The mention of bug 1744990 as related bug was to support the fact that we need to deprecate this part of the code due to the cost of maintaining it as-is, and I see your point about referencing a won't fix bug as odd too.

You are right in that it also affects the PKI token signing support (which is deprecated upstream as of Mitaka). It is somehow entwined with the distribution of the self-signed certs and what I was attempting to accomplish was to disable related code paths with as little changes as possible, other than enclosing the code in if is_legacy_ssl_mgmt_enabled clauses. I will revisit this part and/or raise a separate review to untwine these."}, {'account_id': 13686, 'date': '2018-04-30 06:33:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Workflow-1

Holding off for this cycle, will push forward a PR with deprecation warnings in config only.'}, {'account_id': 13686, 'date': '2018-06-12 13:18:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 13686, 'date': '2018-06-12 13:20:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

This change has been successfully validated with the `full_stack/next_deploy_ssl/queens` spec in https://github.com/fnordahl/openstack-mojo-specs/tree/feature-openstack-component-tls-keystone'}, {'account_id': 13686, 'date': '2018-06-12 14:52:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Workflow-1

There are a few more things that needs to be cleaned up'}, {'account_id': 13686, 'date': '2018-06-12 15:50:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 13686, 'date': '2018-06-12 16:19:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Re-ran the mojo spec with successful outcome (referenced in comment on Patch Set 5)

Results here: https://gist.github.com/fnordahl/552e755bc0b2d2b257f7b14e634cf330'}, {'account_id': 20634, 'date': '2018-06-13 08:09:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+1

Looks fine, want another review considering the size!'}, {'account_id': 12549, 'date': '2018-06-14 08:14:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

LGTM, thanks for the clean up.'}]

commit_message:
Remove support for PKI tokens and legacy charm managed certificates

These features are disabled by default, a majority of our
users provide certificates through configuration.

At present the cluster relation carries information required
for these features even when they are not enabled. This makes
processing of cluster relation changes unnecessarily heavy
and vulnerable to bugs.

Notice of deprecation and removal in next release was given
as part of the 18.05 release notes.

Change-Id: I8b07c7e0d5c2c623c115c83dc8aff230b554a986
Closes-Bug: #1755897
Related-Bug: #1744990

While fixing grammatical errors like this have a small benefit to the code base, we'd love to have you jump into some of the other things we're working on. First reviews on patches are always appreciated. http://not.mn/reviews.html is a gerrit dashboard that shows some important things to work on. You can also look at things that are listed on https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Swift/PriorityReviews or https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Swift/ideas.

If you can get on freenode IRC, please join us in #openstack-swift. We're happy to answer any questions and help you get more involved."}]

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-13 11:34:23.000000000', 'message': 'Fix shard_max_row in ContainerBroker.get_replication_info()

ContainerBroker adds the shard_max_row item to the
get_replication_info result by querying the db for the shard ranges
table max rowid. However, the wrong table name was being used in the
db query such that the value was always -1. This bug was benign
because the value of shard_max_row is not currently used.

Noticed while reviewing [1] which does make use of the shard_max_row
*key* in replication info.

[1] Related-Change: I7231e8af310e268484f2075f0194b7783cf1c3ea

Change-Id: I9e733e301894f1ffff4a1092926cc0df8419c5b5
'}]
commit_message:
Fix shard_max_row in ContainerBroker.get_replication_info()

ContainerBroker adds the shard_max_row item to the
get_replication_info result by querying the db for the shard ranges
table max rowid. However, the wrong table name was being used in the
db query such that the value was always -1. This bug was benign
because the value of shard_max_row is not currently used.

Noticed while reviewing [1] which does make use of the shard_max_row
*key* in replication info.

[1] Related-Change: I7231e8af310e268484f2075f0194b7783cf1c3ea

Change-Id: I9e733e301894f1ffff4a1092926cc0df8419c5b5

commit_message:
Set docker environment files during ffu prepare and converge

This change sets the docker and docker ha environment files during
fast forward upgrade prepare and converge stages for upstream
deployments where the containerized services may be optional.

'}, {'created': '2018-06-13 14:48:47.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Add server name check for multiple creations"

This reverts commit b59f458f2823bfcfd8a530003d34e912110c2f3a.

This breaks the nova-cells-v1 job since the cells v1 API
does not honor the same multi-create instance name format.

Furthermore, prior to Queens, the multi_instance_display_name_template
config option could be used to customize the display name for
multiple servers in a single request. Since Tempest is branchless,
this means deployments older than Queens could now fail this test
if they are customing that option.

Really, the change to assert the server names shouldn't be possible
until the nova pike series enters extended maintenance mode since that
would be the last branch that supports the
multi_instance_display_name_template config option.

Change-Id: Ia9273be6bf9fd55822dfe46f56503f70953c3ff3
Closes-Bug: #1776684

commit_message:
Revert "Add server name check for multiple creations"

This reverts commit b59f458f2823bfcfd8a530003d34e912110c2f3a.

This breaks the nova-cells-v1 job since the cells v1 API
does not honor the same multi-create instance name format.

Furthermore, prior to Rocky [1], the
multi_instance_display_name_template config option could be used to
customize the display name for multiple servers in a single request.
Since Tempest is branchless, this means deployments older than Rocky
could now fail this test if they are customizing that option.

Really, the change to assert the server names shouldn't be possible
until the nova pike series enters extended maintenance mode since that
would be the last branch that supports the
multi_instance_display_name_template config option.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/499612/

Change-Id: Ia9273be6bf9fd55822dfe46f56503f70953c3ff3
Closes-Bug: #1776684

Receives and handles queries from SNMP master agent and returns the data

commit_message:
Add collectd-snmp-agent to collectd Docker

Receives and handles queries from SNMP master agent and returns the data
collected by read plugins. Handles requests only for OIDs specified in
configuration file. To handle SNMP queries the plugin gets data from
collectd and translates requested values from collectd's internal format
to SNMP format.

Change-Id: I97fd12ccee9f546416111e0589f5d770119923af

commit_message:
Add the api versions for Vitrage.

Also, Vitrage is not a management tools - it is used to provide insights
about the topology and alarms in the cloud. Can you please move Vitrage
under the "Data & Analytics" category?

Change-Id: I1d09f5037d368080281d51a6d9c3e7f82b211085

> I would rather put basepython=python3 in the [testenv] and then
 > have an explicit basepython=python{2.7|3.5|3.6} override in the
 > respective sections.  Is there some reason we can't do that? 
 > Smaller delta, fewer places to keep track of (and miss) for future
 > changes, more explicit where explicitness is appropriate.
 > 
 > If we didn't have explicit sections for py35 and py36 (i.e. if we
 > were allowing those to be "automatic") then that'd be different.
 > 
 > Gonna downvote this at least until y'all beat me into submission.

I'm guessing this was the easiest way for Doug to automate the changes to multiple projects (most of which use the "automatic" behavior you describe and therefore require this approach anyway). I'd rather we do what's been done for every other project (#consistency) but I'm also happy to use another approach if it suits. commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in [testenv].

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We must explicitly set basepython in envs that are usually "automatic" -
otherwise due to https://github.com/tox-dev/tox/issues/425 these will
use `basepython` instead of their automatic equivalents.

Change-Id: I1026110f0f1736127cf0af8ec2ef791a0f999e3a
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-27 22:43:47.000000000', 'message': 'Remove force_tenant_isolation from Cinder tests

The force_tenant_isolation flag was hard-coded to true in four of the
volume test classes. This flag, when set to true, forces Tempest to
create projects and users dynamically, which is a big problem if your
cluster has an immutable user source such as LDAP. Furthermore, if
the user wants to run these tests against a pre-defined user accounts
file, it is not possible without removing the hard-coded flag.

This change removes the hard-coded flag from the Cinder volume test
files that have it. The change has been tested using dynamic user and
project creation and also with pre-defined user account (accounts.yaml)
files, and all tests work both ways, depending on how its configured in
etc/tempest.conf.

Closes-Bug: #1734776
Change-Id: I903be7bef81f162685ed448ba0d19901dca00bf1
'}, {'created': '2017-11-28 16:29:43.000000000', 'message': 'Remove force_tenant_isolation from Cinder tests

The force_tenant_isolation flag was hard-coded to true in four of the
volume test classes. This flag, when set to true, forces Tempest to
create projects and users dynamically, which is a big problem if your
cluster has an immutable user source such as LDAP. Furthermore, if
the user wants to run these tests against a pre-defined user accounts
file, it is not possible without removing the hard-coded flag.

This change removes the hard-coded flag from the Cinder volume test
files that have it. Also, in the cases where there is a resource_setup
function defined and it changed the quota set on the primary project,
this change adds the code in resource_setup to save the original quota
values and adds the resource_cleanup code to revert those changes
back to their original quota values, just in case the pre-provisioned
accounts (account.yaml) are used rather than dynamic credentials.

This change has been tested using dynamic user and project creation and
also with pre-provisioned credentials (accounts.yaml), and all tests
work both ways, depending on how its configured in etc/tempest.conf.
There are no resource leaks or quota-related side effects either way.

Closes-Bug: #1734776

'}, {'created': '2017-11-28 23:03:24.000000000', 'message': 'Remove force_tenant_isolation from Cinder tests

The force_tenant_isolation flag was hard-coded to true in four of the
volume test classes. This flag, when set to true, forces Tempest to
create projects and users dynamically, which is a big problem if your
cluster has an immutable user source such as LDAP. Furthermore, if
the user wants to run these tests against a pre-defined user accounts
file, it is not possible without removing the hard-coded flag.

This change removes the hard-coded flag from the Cinder volume test
files that have it. Also, in the cases where there is a resource_setup
function defined and it changed the quota set on the primary project,
this change adds the code in resource_setup to save the original quota
values and the addClassResourceCleanup code to revert those changes
back to their original quota values, just in case the pre-provisioned
accounts (account.yaml) are used rather than dynamic credentials. And
because the AbsoluteLimitsTests class tests no longer need forced
tenant isolation, the class is changed to inherit from BaseVolumeTest
instead of BaseVolumeAdminTest.

This change has been tested using dynamic user and project creation and
also with pre-provisioned credentials (accounts.yaml), and all tests
work both ways, depending on how its configured in etc/tempest.conf.
There are no resource leaks or quota-related side effects either way.

'}, {'created': '2018-06-01 21:19:37.000000000', 'message': 'Remove force_tenant_isolation from Cinder tests

The force_tenant_isolation flag was hard-coded to true in four of the
volume test classes. This flag, when set to true, forces Tempest to

file, it is not possible without removing the hard-coded flag.

This change removes the hard-coded flag from the Cinder volume test
files that have it. Also, in the cases where there is a resource_setup
function defined and it changed the quota set on the primary project,
this change adds the code in resource_setup to save the original quota
values and the addClassResourceCleanup code to revert those changes
back to their original quota values, just in case the pre-provisioned
accounts (account.yaml) are used rather than dynamic credentials. And
because the AbsoluteLimitsTests class tests no longer need forced
tenant isolation, the class is changed to inherit from BaseVolumeTest
instead of BaseVolumeAdminTest, and the resource_setup() is changed
to save the current limits for comparison in the test case (for the
case where pre-provisioned account volume limits were modified from
their default values).

This change has been tested using dynamic user and project creation and
also with pre-provisioned credentials (accounts.yaml), and all tests
work both ways, depending on how its configured in etc/tempest.conf.
There are no resource leaks or quota-related side effects either way.

Closes-Bug: #1734776

commit_message:
Remove force_tenant_isolation from Cinder tests

The force_tenant_isolation flag was hard-coded to true in four of the
volume test classes. This flag, when set to true, forces Tempest to
create projects and users dynamically, which is a big problem if your
cluster has an immutable user source such as LDAP. Furthermore, if
the user wants to run these tests against a pre-defined user accounts
file, it is not possible without removing the hard-coded flag.

This change removes the hard-coded flag from the Cinder volume test
files that have it. Also, in the cases where there is a resource_setup
function defined and it changed the quota set on the primary project,
this change adds the code in resource_setup to save the original quota
values and the addClassResourceCleanup code to revert those changes
back to their original quota values, just in case the pre-provisioned
accounts (account.yaml) are used rather than dynamic credentials. And
because the AbsoluteLimitsTests class tests no longer need forced
tenant isolation, the class is changed to inherit from BaseVolumeTest
instead of BaseVolumeAdminTest, and the resource_setup() is changed
to save the current limits for comparison in the test case (for the
case where pre-provisioned account volume limits were modified from
their default values).

This change has been tested using dynamic user and project creation and
also with pre-provisioned credentials (accounts.yaml), and all tests
work both ways, depending on how its configured in etc/tempest.conf.
There are no resource leaks or quota-related side effects either way.

Closes-Bug: #1734776
Change-Id: I903be7bef81f162685ed448ba0d19901dca00bf1

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-04 15:39:59.000000000', 'message': 'Fix AIO

1) Disable SSL messaging for neutron

For some reason, messaging over SSL is not working for neutron-server
[1], search for line [2].
This is blocking integrated repo patches, so to unblock the repo while
the root cause is figured out, we disable SSL for now.

2) Disable LBaaS v2 on the aio

LBaaS v2 as a unknown problem in migrations [1], search for line [3].
This is blocking integrated repo patches, so to unblock, we
disable LBaaS v2 on the aio.

In any way, the LBaaS v2 shouldn't be enabled on an aio by default.
Instead, a separate scenario for lbaas (octavia) should be used,
as lbaas v2 is not the latest way of doing.

[1]: http://logs.openstack.org/periodic/git.openstack.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/master/openstack-ansible-deploy-aio_lxc-ubuntu-xenial/b9c3eaf/logs/openstack/aio1_neutron_server_container-413a859f/neutron/neutron-server.log
[2]: DBAPIError exception wrapped from (pymysql.err.InternalError) (1054, u"Unknown column 'lbaas_loadbalancers.project_id' in 'field list'")
[3]: MessageDeliveryFailure: Unable to connect to AMQP server on 172.29.236.169:5671 after None tries: (0, 0): (403) ACCESS_REFUSED - Login was refused using authentication mechanism AMQPLAIN. For details see the broker logfile.

Change-Id: Ica513cd898833598d1ade68f9759df59b0d87176
'}]
commit_message:
Fix AIO

1) Disable SSL messaging for neutron

For some reason, messaging over SSL is not working for neutron-server
[1], search for line [2].
This is blocking integrated repo patches, so to unblock the repo while
the root cause is figured out, we disable SSL for now.

2) Disable LBaaS v2 on the aio

LBaaS v2 as a unknown problem in migrations [1], search for line [3].
This is blocking integrated repo patches, so to unblock, we
disable LBaaS v2 on the aio.

In any way, the LBaaS v2 shouldn't be enabled on an aio by default.
Instead, a separate scenario for lbaas (octavia) should be used,
as lbaas v2 is not the latest way of doing.

[1]: http://logs.openstack.org/periodic/git.openstack.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/master/openstack-ansible-deploy-aio_lxc-ubuntu-xenial/b9c3eaf/logs/openstack/aio1_neutron_server_container-413a859f/neutron/neutron-server.log
[2]: DBAPIError exception wrapped from (pymysql.err.InternalError) (1054, u"Unknown column 'lbaas_loadbalancers.project_id' in 'field list'")
[3]: MessageDeliveryFailure: Unable to connect to AMQP server on 172.29.236.169:5671 after None tries: (0, 0): (403) ACCESS_REFUSED - Login was refused using authentication mechanism AMQPLAIN. For details see the broker logfile.

Change-Id: Ica513cd898833598d1ade68f9759df59b0d87176

commit_message:
Use HostAddressOpt for opts that accept IP and hostnames

Some configuration options were accepting both IP addresses
and hostnames. Since there was no specific OSLO opt type to
support this, we were using ``StrOpt``. The change [1] that
added support for ``HostAddressOpt`` type was merged in Ocata
and became available for use with oslo version 3.22.

This patch changes the opt type of configuration options to use
this more relevant opt type - HostAddressOpt.

[1] I77bdb64b7e6e56ce761d76696bc4448a9bd325eb

Change-Id: Id179ad55d4344a7dc2214896290890862b560e0c

commit_message:
Remove volume v1 API service client usage

Volume v1 API has been gone since long and Tempest also
marked their deprecation since Juno
- https://review.openstack.org/#/c/446238/

Now Tempest is removing the deprecated config option and
alias for voluem v1 service client in
- https://review.openstack.org/#/c/573135/

Before the Tempest patch gets merged, we need to remove all usage
of volume v1 things.

Change-Id: Iac5d1914814afbe81f3d83c875620931884584cd
Needed-By: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/573135/

commit_message:
Obtain a token right before API test execution

Currently authentication token for Heat API tests is obtained once during
test suite initialization.

This patch introduces Gabbi fixture and corresponding changes to tests which
assures a token is requested before test execution

Change-Id: I0e2a044c383a68b2e7b019d0028fbb81d833ef56
Story: 1762493
Task: 18915

[{'created': '2018-06-07 18:17:02.000000000', 'message': 'Unfreeze master

unfreeze the ansible-role-requirements to allow role iterations.

The version of OSA has been bumped at the same time to be ready
for the next freeze.

commit_message:
Unfreeze master

Now that master has a patch for releasing milestone 2, we can
unfreeze the ansible-role-requirements to allow role iterations.

The version of OSA has been bumped at the same time to be ready
for the next freeze.

Change-Id: Ibfd14d2113ff41d8548551881846cdfaa927d6d6
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/573394/

commit_message:
Use correct modify_append_tag key (again)

The fix in If19e2f3f723e437b2213cacc2f4dfdbe2e0ffce0 was incomplete,
the correct modify_append_tag key needs to be set here too.

This is the current cause for the CI failure in the change
I62a4b03538d26083a0ba4ce0b2e7a5b0c456134d.

Change-Id: I665c0cc61fdf552c7776a5ca1272984923557e06
Blueprint: container-prepare-workflow

commit_message:
api-ref: Fix some params in volume types

This patch adds some missing params in volume types
and volume type access APIs. Also trivial fix for
the order of the params in the URL.

Change-Id: I767f68b4252a3b70755494cf82ca3b284112be75

When bootstrapping the vagrant dev environment run commands on the
operator node to set up the kolla-cli, and to set up the host

commit_message:
Set up the kolla-cli and inventory for the vagrant dev environment

When bootstrapping the vagrant dev environment run commands on the
operator node to set up the kolla-cli, and to set up the host
inventory as appropriate for either multinode or aio deployment.

Change-Id: I7765d5302329919dce6317d78b84af1c7bf572b3

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-12 02:50:43.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I76c5d2c770a4a46c46b5f6e1852c1ac18a23cce4
'}, {'created': '2018-06-13 13:34:39.000000000', 'message': 'change default python 3 env in tox to 3.5 

Change-Id: I76c5d2c770a4a46c46b5f6e1852c1ac18a23cce4
'}]

change default python 3 env in tox to 3.5

subject: containerized undercloud may be contributing to long run times
messages: [{'account_id': 9592, 'date': '2018-06-13 22:39:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-06-13 23:48:22.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned\n\nhttps://review.openstack.org/#/c/575264/'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-13 22:39:58.000000000', 'message': 'containerized undercloud may be contributing to long run times

As of today the upstream zuul queue is running around 24hrs.
Looking at trends that might be contributing to the issue
We have identified pulling containers twice per job from
docker.io as suspect.

The working being done in [1], may help. There is also
the possiblity of using a docker registry up front [2]
Finally we should explore options around a reverse
proxy [3].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/q/topic:bp/container-prepare-workflow+(status:open+OR+status:merged)
[2] https://github.com/openstack/ansible-role-container-registry
[3] https://docs.docker.com/engine/reference/commandline/pull/#proxy-configuration

Change-Id: I4f4af6c2a3f9b0547042100373c7ade5632c1092
'}]
commit_message:
containerized undercloud may be contributing to long run times

As of today the upstream zuul queue is running around 24hrs.
Looking at trends that might be contributing to the issue
We have identified pulling containers twice per job from
docker.io as suspect.

The working being done in [1], may help. There is also
the possiblity of using a docker registry up front [2]
Finally we should explore options around a reverse
proxy [3].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/q/topic:bp/container-prepare-workflow+(status:open+OR+status:merged)
[2] https://github.com/openstack/ansible-role-container-registry
[3] https://docs.docker.com/engine/reference/commandline/pull/#proxy-configuration

Change-Id: I4f4af6c2a3f9b0547042100373c7ade5632c1092

commit_message:
Add util for action validation to standardise use

Adding a validation util function to help with standardising
how we do action validation, so that validation doesn't continue
after one failure.

Change-Id: I4b46fbfa1382ca94b0821a76439675120be5af60

subject: Add python3 django 1.11 job instead of django 2.0 job
messages: [{'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-06-13 10:31:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 16352, 'date': '2018-06-14 04:04:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-13 10:31:20.000000000', 'message': 'Add python3 django 1.11 job instead of django 2.0 job

Django 2.0 is now used in tox py35 job, so there is no need for
py35dj20 job. Instead, Django 1.11 with python3 is not covered.

- py35dj20 job is dropped from tox.ini.
- python3-django111 is added to tox.ini.
  python3 is specified to basepython to avoid a specific python version.
- .zuul.yaml is updated to consume horizon-openstack-tox-python3-django111
  and drop horizon-openstack-tox-py35dj20.

Change-Id: Ib6f271d9cc8446875d6284a1f7d9f17aab90c47c
'}]
commit_message:
Add python3 django 1.11 job instead of django 2.0 job

Django 2.0 is now used in tox py35 job, so there is no need for
py35dj20 job. Instead, Django 1.11 with python3 is not covered.

- py35dj20 job is dropped from tox.ini.
- python3-django111 is added to tox.ini.
  python3 is specified to basepython to avoid a specific python version.
- .zuul.yaml is updated to consume horizon-openstack-tox-python3-django111
  and drop horizon-openstack-tox-py35dj20.

Change-Id: Ib6f271d9cc8446875d6284a1f7d9f17aab90c47c

commit_message:
releasenotes: Declare openSUSE Leap 42.3 as supported distribution

openSUSE Leap 42.3 is a voting job during the Rocky cycle so we can
effectively declrare it as supported.

(3 comments)

This looks like a great change!  I starred it.

FWIW anyone else that might be putting off looking at this - the only requirement for these tests is that domain_remap is in the pipeline, which all that does is rewrite url using host headers (no dns cname weirdness)

these functional tests just connect to the endpoint that comes back from auth, then make requests like this:

GET /container/obj
Host: account.example.com

if you look at the tox-*-func jobs you can see these tests are all getting skipped in the gate - let's try to update the example config to include domain_remap in the pipeline [1] and check the logs again...

I have a vsaio branch going to test this if anyone needs it

https://github.com/swiftstack/vagrant-swift-all-in-one/tree/saio-domain-remap"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-05-12 15:49:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Verified-1

switching my vote to -1 for now after discussion in swift meeting.

1. Adding domain_remap to the defalt sampel pipeline is questioned. But we should be able to use an in process func test to ensure that the new tests are run in the gate.

2. We need to be able to discover the storage_domain so that the tests can pass against *any* endpoint that advertises domain_remap in /info

[1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/swift/2017/swift.2017-08-30-21.00.log.html'}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2017-08-31 08:08:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Just some follow up to my last comment...IMHO, this patch needs to provide tests that will either skip or pass with any swift endpoint, but not add domain_remap to the sample pipeline.

Then, in a follow on patch, we can provide a way for the tests to run in a gate test, perhaps using an in process test with custom pipeline.'}, {'account_id': 13852, 'date': '2017-09-14 19:36:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Patch Set 7 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 13852, 'date': '2017-09-14 20:31:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 13852, 'date': '2017-09-14 20:34:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

Last patchset:
- remove domain_remap from the default pipeline
- auto-discover the storage domain based on the info returned by auth system

I'm not in favor to publish storage_domain, because:
- the real storage_domain is what's returned by keystone or tempauth
- an operator might want to hide some deprecated storage_domain while still supporting them"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-09-14 22:42:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Verified-1

@Romain sorry it has taken me so long to return to this patch (my excuse: deep containers).

-1 because the tests fail for me when run against a default SAIO.

Detecting the correct storage_domain seems like a hard problem to overcome without publishing the domain_remap storage_domain, and on patchset 9 you give good reasons for not doing that.

But maybe I am confused. On patchset 9 you comment 'the real storage_domain is what's returned by keystone or tempauth' - is that by convention, that domain_remap would typically have storage_domain equal to the auth host? I can't see how the auth middleware would otherwise use the storage_domain configured in domain_remap?"}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2018-06-07 11:04:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

I'm getting:

F0417 09:24:18.071500   20651 kubelet.go:1364] Failed to start ContainerManager failed to initialize top level QOS containers: root container /kubepods doesn't exist

How do you run kubelet? In a container or you have a special image?"}, {'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2018-04-17 10:00:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Kubelet is a service that runs on worker nodes. The config for kubelet can be found under /etc/kubernetes/kubelet. To add to the previous comment, I am speaking of a case where magnum has already successfully deployed a kubernetes cluster but you manually ssh into a worker VM and make these changes.'}, {'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2018-04-17 10:14:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-16 12:42:39.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes k8s FailedNodeAllocatableEnforcement warning

This commit fixes FailedNodeAllocatableEnforcement warning under kubectl
node events which is not supposed to appear under default settings
pointed out in Kubernetes docs:

    https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/administer-cluster/reserve-compute-resources/#enabling-qos-and-pod-level-cgroups.

This is addressed by passing cgroups-per-qos and
enforce-node-allocatable arguments to KUBELET_ARGS when kube worker
nodes are being configured.

Closes-Bug: #1763405

Change-Id: I452840eebb955be9fd178b582be74242e949b662
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes k8s FailedNodeAllocatableEnforcement warning

This commit fixes FailedNodeAllocatableEnforcement warning under kubectl
node events which is not supposed to appear under default settings
pointed out in Kubernetes docs:

    https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/administer-cluster/reserve-compute-resources/#enabling-qos-and-pod-level-cgroups.

This is addressed by passing cgroups-per-qos and
enforce-node-allocatable arguments to KUBELET_ARGS when kube worker
nodes are being configured.

Closes-Bug: #1763405

Change-Id: I452840eebb955be9fd178b582be74242e949b662

commit_message:
Copy over docker logs if any

It is often the case that we need docker logs for trouble-shooting.
We tried to copy over the logs at project-config or the post_gate_hook
but it didn't work well. The logs won't be copied over if the jobs
were failed or timeout.

Change-Id: I2c0088514a7d5e59a61599c0f4fe8070620d8e0b

commit_message:
Update all SHAs for 15.1.23

This patch updates all the roles to the latest available stable
SHA's, copies the release notes from the updated roles into the
integrated repo, updates all the OpenStack Service SHA's, and
updates the appropriate python requirements pins.

Depends-On: I1c8fd191b8c04835e9d3781b42a32dd3aca2b0f9
Change-Id: I36bfd6f05aa837dcae6501326aff75a3ba58fb3f

> We may need a microversion for this, since it's a change to existing behavior.

Roger, captain. Let me enter the microversion war."}, {'account_id': 15888, 'date': '2018-04-02 09:03:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Minor nits in comments, and a question, I don't know much about the history here, but why do we want the full usage summary here? since we may only care about the resource class that are requested, and this change could degrade the performance if the provider has many resource classes and we only ask for one, and there are many resource providers in the env. Imagine public cloud, we may have a deployment for very large amount of users with different usecases, so we may have alot of custom resource classes other than CPU, RAM, DISK, but for one specific user, he/she may ask for only one of the use case, then the performance could be bad in such a large depolyment."}, {'account_id': 20722, 'date': '2018-04-03 10:01:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

tiny typo in rest_api_version_history.rst'}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2018-04-05 05:38:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2018-04-05 05:43:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Workflow-1

Zhenyu Zheng:

Valid point. I updated the commit message to response your question. But this is still controversial.  See https://review.openstack.org/#/c/556873/ for details.
-W this until the spec is landed on.'}, {'account_id': 7634, 'date': '2018-04-05 05:48:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-31 09:42:24.000000000', 'message': "Add unrequested resources to provider_summaries

In ``GET /allocation_candidates`` API, ``provider_summaries``
should show all the inventories for all the resource classes
in all the resource providers.

However, ``provider_summaries`` currently doesn't contain
resources that aren't requested.

To fix this, this patch renames _get_usages_by_provider_and_rc
to _get_usages_by_provider and changes it to consider all
resource classes even if it is not requested.

Change-Id: Ic491f190ebd97d94c18931a0e78d779a55ee47a1
Closes-Bug: #1760276

In ``GET /allocation_candidates`` API, ``provider_summaries``

Closes-Bug: #1760276
"}, {'created': '2018-04-05 05:38:55.000000000', 'message': 'Return all resources in provider_summaries

To support nested provider allocation candidates, we agreed that
the placement service returns all providers in a particular provider
tree that match the search criteria so that callers (like the filter
scheduler in nova) can use this hierarchy information in making
further sorting or filtering decisions.

However, ``provider_summaries`` currently doesn't contain resources
that aren't requested. This will be a technical barrier to change the
allocation_candidates API to "return all nested providers in a tree".

To fix this, this patch renames _get_usages_by_provider_and_rc
to _get_usages_by_provider and changes it to consider all
resource classes even if it is not requested.

Because this patch changes the API response, the fix is done with
a new microversion.

Change-Id: Ic491f190ebd97d94c18931a0e78d779a55ee47a1
Closes-Bug: #1760276
'}, {'created': '2018-04-07 06:20:36.000000000', 'message': "Return all resources in provider_summaries

The response of ``GET /allocation_candidates`` API provides two fields
of ``allocation_requests`` and ``provider_summaries``. The callers,
like the filter scheduler in nova, would use information in
``provider_summaries`` in sorting or filtering providers to allocate
consumers.

However, currently ``provider_summaries`` doesn't contain resources
that aren't requested.

To fix this, this patch renames _get_usages_by_provider_and_rc
to _get_usages_by_provider and changes it to consider and return
all resource classes with a new microversion.

Change-Id: Ic491f190ebd97d94c18931a0e78d779a55ee47a1
Closes-Bug: #1760276
Blueprint: placement-return-all-resources

commit_message:
Return all resources in provider_summaries

The response of ``GET /allocation_candidates`` API provides two fields
of ``allocation_requests`` and ``provider_summaries``. The callers,
like the filter scheduler in nova, would use information in
``provider_summaries`` in sorting or filtering providers to allocate
consumers. However, currently ``provider_summaries`` doesn't contain
resource classes that aren't requested.

With this patch, ``GET /allocation_candidates`` API returns all
resource classes with a new microversion.

Change-Id: Ic491f190ebd97d94c18931a0e78d779a55ee47a1
Closes-Bug: #1760276
Blueprint: placement-return-all-resources

subject: Add python3 django 1.11 job instead of django 2.0 job
messages: [{'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-06-13 11:27:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-06-14 02:28:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1\n\nmaintenance patch. Let me merge this.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-13 11:27:47.000000000', 'message': 'Add python3 django 1.11 job instead of django 2.0 job

Django 2.0 is now used in tox py35 job, so there is no need for
py35dj20 job. Instead, Django 1.11 with python3 is not covered.

- py35dj20 job is dropped from tox.ini.
- python3-django111 is added to tox.ini.
  python3 is specified to basepython to avoid a specific python version.
- .zuul.yaml is updated to consume horizon-openstack-tox-python3-django111
  and drop horizon-openstack-tox-py35dj20.

Change-Id: I4bf1a19f46a895f3569d7a79739ac1a7ebf91cbc
'}]
commit_message:
Add python3 django 1.11 job instead of django 2.0 job

Django 2.0 is now used in tox py35 job, so there is no need for
py35dj20 job. Instead, Django 1.11 with python3 is not covered.

- py35dj20 job is dropped from tox.ini.
- python3-django111 is added to tox.ini.
  python3 is specified to basepython to avoid a specific python version.
- .zuul.yaml is updated to consume horizon-openstack-tox-python3-django111
  and drop horizon-openstack-tox-py35dj20.

Change-Id: I4bf1a19f46a895f3569d7a79739ac1a7ebf91cbc

commit_message:
Use "openstack tripleo container image prepare"

The file containers-prepare-parameter.yaml is written during
undercloud-deploy. This change uses that file as the input to the call
to "openstack tripleo container image prepare".

Because this file also specifies doing yum updates on images during
the modify_role, the call to container-check is also removed.

Depends-On: I665c0cc61fdf552c7776a5ca1272984923557e06
Change-Id: Ie8d40ace959d5affd739bdbdf369c6211a2751f5
Blueprint: container-prepare-workflow

[{'created': '2018-05-25 07:59:06.000000000', 'message': 'Options to enable SSL for backend connections

Currently backend connections are always unencrypted. This adds optional
parameters to configure backend connections with SSL. This is useful for
extra services wich require SSL or to have backend connections to
OpenStack services encrypted in the future.

Change-Id: I6a032962ae987bb1cbc4982fb6ddbd06f8e53936
(cherry picked from commit 2d0f483c843d7bd0db8eb7dc5f2f169714c73169)
'}]
commit_message:
Options to enable SSL for backend connections

Currently backend connections are always unencrypted. This adds optional
parameters to configure backend connections with SSL. This is useful for
extra services wich require SSL or to have backend connections to
OpenStack services encrypted in the future.

Change-Id: I6a032962ae987bb1cbc4982fb6ddbd06f8e53936
(cherry picked from commit 2d0f483c843d7bd0db8eb7dc5f2f169714c73169)

Don't install zypper on bionic

zypper isn't avaialble on bionic, so avoid it in bindep

commit_message:
Rename output log files

Rename output log files so they can be quickly identified as passing
or failing logs just by the filename.  Put them all in the same
directory for similar reasons.

Change-Id: I75bbe724e0d20c6561c2bf93857499cc49474250

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-12 15:06:20.000000000', 'message': 'Add python3 django 1.11 job instead of django 2.0 job

Django 2.0 is now used in tox py35 job, so there is no need for
py35dj20 job. Instead, Django 1.11 with python3 is not covered.

- py35dj20 job is dropped from tox.ini.
- python3-django111 is added to tox.ini.
  python3 is specified to basepython to avoid a specific python version.
- .zuul.yaml is updated to consume horizon-openstack-tox-python3-django111
  and drop horizon-openstack-tox-py35dj20.

Change-Id: I90485a472edb5d2446c7e1bc08554fec72b307a0
'}]
commit_message:
Add python3 django 1.11 job instead of django 2.0 job

Django 2.0 is now used in tox py35 job, so there is no need for
py35dj20 job. Instead, Django 1.11 with python3 is not covered.

- py35dj20 job is dropped from tox.ini.
- python3-django111 is added to tox.ini.
  python3 is specified to basepython to avoid a specific python version.
- .zuul.yaml is updated to consume horizon-openstack-tox-python3-django111
  and drop horizon-openstack-tox-py35dj20.

Change-Id: I90485a472edb5d2446c7e1bc08554fec72b307a0

commit_message:
[WIP] logging: add fluentd configuration to additional services

while reviewing the fluentd integration it became obvious that we
were missing the logging configuration for several services. This
patch begins to address that issue.

Partial-bug: #1715187
Depends-on: I2b057190ec0e4e75ee4ee47ebe0164c2644e5ab7

commit_message:
[WIP] logging: update default log format to handle gnocchi

gnocchi uses daiquiri rather than oslo.log, which has a slightly
different default log format. it is close enough that we can still
match it with the default log pattern with only minor changes.

Change-Id: I26173116f390172612e3e45270118530333fd0dc
Partial-bug: #1715187
Depends-on: I2b057190ec0e4e75ee4ee47ebe0164c2644e5ab7

commit_message:
logging: remove fluentd integration from common/services.yaml

This removes from common/services.yaml the mechanism originally used
to aggregate fluentd configuration from the service chain.  This has
been replaced by the use of service_config_settings.

Change-Id: I8f9878c05bf1334b16751684c19d70b97c4fff6f
Partial-bug: #1715187
Depends-On: I2b057190ec0e4e75ee4ee47ebe0164c2644e5ab7
Depends-On: I28028ffa00df2da8e0478a551d3de89c3ee46e1f

[{'created': '2018-05-25 07:59:21.000000000', 'message': 'Options to enable SSL for backend connections

Currently backend connections are always unencrypted. This adds optional
parameters to configure backend connections with SSL. This is useful for
extra services wich require SSL or to have backend connections to
OpenStack services encrypted in the future.

Change-Id: I6a032962ae987bb1cbc4982fb6ddbd06f8e53936
(cherry picked from commit 2d0f483c843d7bd0db8eb7dc5f2f169714c73169)

commit_message:
Options to enable SSL for backend connections

Currently backend connections are always unencrypted. This adds optional
parameters to configure backend connections with SSL. This is useful for
extra services wich require SSL or to have backend connections to
OpenStack services encrypted in the future.

Change-Id: I6a032962ae987bb1cbc4982fb6ddbd06f8e53936
(cherry picked from commit 2d0f483c843d7bd0db8eb7dc5f2f169714c73169)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-07 14:31:01.000000000', 'message': 'Adding rpc_pipefs for lxc-openstack aa profile

The RPC pipefs is needed for NFS kernel/userspace
interaction and need to be added to the LXC profile.
This is important for containers like glance-api who
can mount NFS onto `/var/lib/glance/images`.

Change-Id: Ib1a697ad9a63dd1f7be66321291882ffab82255a
Closes-Bug: #1774037
'}]
commit_message:
Adding rpc_pipefs for lxc-openstack aa profile

The RPC pipefs is needed for NFS kernel/userspace
interaction and need to be added to the LXC profile.
This is important for containers like glance-api who
can mount NFS onto `/var/lib/glance/images`.

Change-Id: Ib1a697ad9a63dd1f7be66321291882ffab82255a
Closes-Bug: #1774037

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-13 15:23:05.000000000', 'message': 'Use realpath filter instead of the stat/dir dance

We can make the deployment more efficient if we use the realpath
filter, instead of first checking for the directory and then
implementing the changes in a follow-up task.

This is more readable, simpler and faster to execute.

Change-Id: Iaa6c1873330370ae62cd29e7d4c211c7211b703d
'}]
commit_message:
Use realpath filter instead of the stat/dir dance

We can make the deployment more efficient if we use the realpath
filter, instead of first checking for the directory and then
implementing the changes in a follow-up task.

This is more readable, simpler and faster to execute.

Change-Id: Iaa6c1873330370ae62cd29e7d4c211c7211b703d

commit_message:
placement: Use INNER JOIN for requied traits

Getting allocation candidates, placement calls _get_trees_matching_all
to get all trees that satisfy user requests. The function consisted of
two phases, checking the amount of inventory and checking traits.

This patch extracts checking traits phase into separated function,
_get_trees_with_traits and creates tests specialized to trait check.

This patch also changes the SQL logic to use different join tables
for required and forbidden traits to make it more efficient according
to the comment in [1].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/567113/14/nova/api/openstack/placement/objects/resource_provider.py@3346

Change-Id: Ief8d982899d4203d79fb4b5117340d92b9d3a94e
Blueprint: nested-resource-providers-allocation-candidate
Co-Authored-By: Jay Pipes <jaypipes@gmail.com>

A release note should be added.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2017-11-16 19:15:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

I'm not sure how useful this is. The API response is not very useful. The attachment ID is the same value as the volume ID that the user has to provide to this CLI:

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/0de06818955c3a77d002a8295b43f17cbd894b25/nova/api/openstack/compute/volumes.py#L226

So the only other piece that is of any value is the device, but that device name might not actually be what's in the guest for the instance. Since the Liberty release, the libvirt driver has completely ignored the device name that a user supplies when attaching a volume to a server, and the driver (and hypervisor) actually calculate the device itself. Plus if you reboot the guest, the hypervisor might mount the block device in a different location, so the device name in the API is really something we shouldn't build upon as something that is stable and we want people using, see:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/452546/"}, {'account_id': 21135, 'date': '2018-06-14 00:54:13.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Change log desc for volume attach and detach

The argument is volume ID, not the attachment ID.
So the argument name of the function here is easy to misunderstand.

Change-Id: Idf8595bf22fe340d8cae7f2611778db56d22fe85

commit_message:
Update the validate way for nova service

As usually, we list nova service to validate, use
"openstack compute service list" is better.

Change-Id: Ie1857c1ae238ef610e62aead99aa1ef0fc68c695

Add log directory option to functional tests

This option to the functional test runner outputs logs for each test
to ${LOGDIR}/${element}/${test_element}.log

Change-Id: I3bf5362bcda8acda1a03c1058728875a9a6c9711

commit_message:
lxc_install_dnf: Fix symlink

Commit cf847ca8da943518fad3730789442f48066635d7 ("Trivial: Fix the pep8
warning") broke the dnf->yum symlink since it added the usual '---' to
the dnf yaml file. However, this is not a real file but a symlink to the
yum one resulting to the following broken symlink

lxc_install_dnf.yml -> ---?lxc_install_yum.yml

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/574382/
Change-Id: I64f98468bf9cee57aeb25ddf9868f785310e23a8

commit_message:
Add domain name to aodh.conf template

Adds settings to the aodh config file which allows the correct project
and domain to be used for the service account and to access gnocchi.

Change-Id: I7c4d5d569c2e90378ad698ed9d480f359770b64d
Closes-Bug: #1775501

commit_message:
snmp: make oid value retrieval more solid

There's no need to try to convert before ignoring.

Change-Id: Ie9dcb63c43e7d69ce25aff62a2575b89f26ffca5
(cherry picked from commit 7de90448e6c61a8bef7663ad87a87b3be587b36e)

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-07-04 04:25:42.000000000', 'message': '[WiP] OSprofiler with OpenTracing compatible

This is the very first PoC of OpenTracing compatible in OSprofiler.

In this patch, I use Uber Jaeger as a tracer.
Trace/span from OSprofiler will be sent to Jaeger.
We can use Jaeger UI to view trace.

I used Jaeger all-in-one and jaeger-client to demonstrate this PoC.

A sample image of trace in Jaeger:
https://tovin07.github.io/opentracing/jaeger-openstack-image-list.png

Reference:
- OpenTracing: http://opentracing.io/
- Uber Jager: http://jaeger.readthedocs.io/en/latest/

Additional requirements (for this PoC):
- Docker engine to run jaeger all-in-one
- `pip install jaeger-client` to instrument OSprofiler

Change-Id: I8f75af487f50d5e67a1321a4c951d2a0d85733a1
Implements: blueprint opentracing-compatible

This is the very first PoC of OpenTracing compatible in OSprofiler.

In this patch, I use Uber Jaeger as a tracer.
Trace/span from OSprofiler will be sent to Jaeger.
We can use Jaeger UI to view trace.

I used Jaeger all-in-one and jaeger-client to demonstrate this PoC.

A sample image of trace in Jaeger:
https://tovin07.github.io/opentracing/jaeger-openstack-image-list.png

Reference:
- OpenTracing: http://opentracing.io/
- Uber Jager: http://jaeger.readthedocs.io/en/latest/

Additional requirements (for this PoC):
- Docker engine to run jaeger all-in-one
- `pip install jaeger-client` to instrument OSprofiler

Depends-On: Iaac3ac3853867a67f7e386e762e0522076235daf

Change-Id: I8f75af487f50d5e67a1321a4c951d2a0d85733a1
Implements: blueprint opentracing-compatible

commit_message:
OSprofiler with Jaeger Tracing as backend

In this patch, I use Uber Jaeger as a tracer.
Trace/span from OSprofiler will be sent to Jaeger.
We can use Jaeger UI to view trace.

A sample image of trace in Jaeger:
https://tovin07.github.io/opentracing/jaeger-openstack-image-list.png

Reference:
- OpenTracing: http://opentracing.io/
- Uber Jager: https://www.jaegertracing.io/docs/

Depends-On: Iaac3ac3853867a67f7e386e762e0522076235daf

Change-Id: I8f75af487f50d5e67a1321a4c951d2a0d85733a1
Implements: blueprint opentracing-compatible

commit_message:
Reflect change to multiple clusters creation

APIv2 has been experimental; we've made a change to endpoint for the
creation of multiple clusters.

Change-Id: Idc37b263ceabc9edaf6cab5e24fa83c836edc16d

subject: Add leading 0 on alpha release in semver doc
messages:
[{'account_id': 27201, 'date': '2018-04-02 09:18:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 27201, 'date': '2018-04-02 09:18:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 27201, 'date': '2018-04-02 09:21:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

I have updated the doc to reflect the behavor of PBR on automatic alpha release. I think it is a good practice to tells user to tag their own alpha release with .0a1 instead of .a1 (event if PBR does "see" this alpha version)'}, {'account_id': 27201, 'date': '2018-04-05 18:27:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I don't feel the error comes from me:

> 2018-04-02 09:31:18.840280 | primary | ImportError: cannot import name requests

http://logs.openstack.org/81/558181/2/check/legacy-pbr-installation-dsvm-upstream/4f1b49e/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-04-02_09_31_18_840280"}, {'account_id': 27201, 'date': '2018-04-07 08:52:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 27201, 'date': '2018-04-16 21:56:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 27201, 'date': '2018-04-16 21:56:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 27201, 'date': '2018-05-24 14:42:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Patch Set 4 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-06-06 17:55:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2018-06-08 10:57:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Thanks for this :)'}, {'account_id': 27201, 'date': '2018-06-13 20:08:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

can someone merge this patch?'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-06-13 20:57:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

> can someone merge this patch?

It is merged. Are you not seeing it somewhere you expect?'}, {'account_id': 27201, 'date': '2018-06-13 21:36:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

hello. My mistake. I saw its real status after posting my comment :) thanks for that !'}]

commit_message:
Update python3 versions in tox.ini envlist

This updates the envlist to include modern versions of python. It
doesn't really mean anything except for you run tox without specifying
an environment it will now run py35 and py36 instead of py34 (which
isn't used anywhere anymore)

Change-Id: I935cf6d104fa5b516332cbb587d327dc587d0c32

commit_message:
Set docker environment files during ffu prepare and converge

This change sets the docker and docker ha environment files during
fast forward upgrade prepare and converge stages for upstream
deployments where the containerized services may be optional.

Change-Id: I9a6c7be62448763297330bc116d8675984ab915d

commit_message:
Remove DragonFlow tagging ACL

The release process for official OpenStack components now uses
release requests using changes proposed to the openstack/releases
git repository. This allows peer review of release requests,
including version numbers, and run a series of checks to make
sure the release is likely to be successful once the tag is
pushed. The same process supports the creation of additional repo
branches as well. This all ensures that releases are reported
correctly on the releases.openstack.org website.

DragonFlow is an official governed project and should be doing
all releases through the official release process. This
removes the ACL rights for the team to push their own tags.

Change-Id: I5f10d27c8b2f1e30e774f8011a9c0a01af7d871f

commit_message:
Remove nitrogen from n-odl grafana

The OpenDaylight version nitrogen has been marked EOL and thus no longer
supported.

This patch removes the monitoring of the jobs for that version.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/572362

commit_message:
remove the pike->queens upgrade job

The intent of the job is to only test queens
to master.  With the new emit_releases_file.py
in play when queens is triggered we should see
queens -> master kick vs.. pike to queens for
this job.

Change-Id: I81cc899372fc473f52b3512f383ca655f42e7fcc

I was looking at wheel build failures, and in some cases builds fail
because they're not constrained to versions already in the
constraints.

For example; pylxd failed to build a wheel [1] due to [2], but
upper-constraints.txt would have kept urllib to 1.22.  Similarly
several django plugins fail on python2 as they try to bring in Django2
which only works with python3.

Pass the upper-constraints.txt to the wheel build to ensure consistent
building.

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/periodic/git.openstack.org/openstack/requirements/master/publish-wheel-mirror-centos-7/723e75b/python2/failed.txt

[2] https://github.com/requests/requests/issues/4673

Change-Id: I788994b69afd2769489454a3b16f84bea4c56e59

upper-constraints.txt would have kept urllib to 1.22.  Similarly

Pass the upper-constraints.txt to the wheel build to ensure consistent
building.

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/periodic/git.openstack.org/openstack/requirements/master/publish-wheel-mirror-centos-7/723e75b/python2/failed.txt

commit_message:
Build wheels against constraints

I was looking at wheel build failures, and in some cases builds fail
because they're not constrained to versions already in the
constraints.

For example; pylxd failed to build a wheel [1] due to [2], but
upper-constraints.txt would have kept urllib to 1.22.  Similarly
several django plugins fail on python2 as they try to bring in Django2
which only works with python3.

Pass the upper-constraints.txt to the wheel build to ensure consistent
building.

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/periodic/git.openstack.org/openstack/requirements/master/publish-wheel-mirror-centos-7/723e75b/python2/failed.txt

[2] https://github.com/requests/requests/issues/4673

Change-Id: I788994b69afd2769489454a3b16f84bea4c56e59
