commit_message:
Remove direct tagging from heat-cfntools ACL

Releases are now driven from the openstack/releases repository
so that they go through a series of tests before the tag is
actually pushed. Future releases of heat-cfntools (if any)
should go through that process.

Change-Id: Idd1292636f1cefaa42a04c1490eb6985e2d8b2eb

commit_message:
Deprecate module_plugins

An upstream change in keystone has removed the requirement to define the
module_plugins for the Mellon, Openidc and Shibboleth federation
configs.

Change-Id: I9ef488df3564f5b01ba7cf8e6a7957565858e27e

commit_message:
Add ability to upgrade FROM change under test

Currently, we are only able to upgrade TO a change under test. (n-1->n)
This change adds an argument (--upgrade-from), which allows for testing
that a change does not break upgrading FROM a release. (n->n+1)

The change itself is a no-op other than changing the signature of the
compose_releases_dictionary method.

Change-Id: I141aa5e01a097968a2a3427ebcfb5b8d304c9753

commit_message:
Create an additional network interface on libvirt subnode

For standalone reproducing we need another interface (eth1) on
the subnode. Add it to libivrt template of subnode.
see also https://review.openstack.org/#/c/572732/

Change-Id: I016f30785aebd3ab7f5b3e3e5f1012b41dc05f89

commit_message:
Remove mox in libvirt/test_driver.py (4)

Replace mox with mock or stub_out in the following methods of
the LibvirtConnTestCase
in nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py.

* test_spawn_without_image_meta
* test_spawn_with_pci_devices
* _test_create_image_plain
* test_create_ephemeral_with_arbitrary
* test_create_ephemeral_with_ext3
* test_conn_event_handler
* test_command_with_broken_connection
* test_service_resume_after_broken_connection
* test_immediate_delete
* test_reboot_different_ids
* test_destroy_timed_out
* test_private_destroy_not_found
* test_undefine_domain_with_not_found_instance
* test_cpu_info
* test_get_pcidev_info

Subsequent patches will replace mox in other test cases.

Change-Id: Id4055e51f397a6c900ae42a18d067ae584aaef23
Implements: blueprint mox-removal

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-06-13 12:32:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 8175, 'date': '2018-06-13 13:06:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-06-13 13:23:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 8175, 'date': '2018-06-13 13:38:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 18851, 'date': '2018-06-13 13:58:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

> (1 comment)

Previously(checked on Queens) openstack-tripleo-validations was installed automatically by the undercloud install:

Notice: /Stage[main]/Tripleo::Profile::Base::Validations/Package[openstack-tripleo-validations]/ensure: created

Which means that this changed and we're not doing it anymore so I am a bit reluctant to doing it manually until we know the cause of this change(it might be a regression). Manually installing it might cover some other issues, e.g there are validations that run post undercloud upgrade so if we don't install the package automatically anymore then they will fail to run."}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-06-13 18:22:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-06-13 18:23:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Marius is right, it's a bug and I'll fix it. I'm on it now."}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-06-13 18:41:41.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

https://review.openstack.org/575193 and https://review.openstack.org/575196'}]

commit_message:
before executing tripleo-inventory esure it's installed

Ensure that openstack-tripleo-inventory is installed
prior to calling inventory.

Change-Id: I18dcc16503ce4fd5ae806798dcca56a95b6ea98d

commit_message:
Power fault recovery: tempest tests

Add tempest tests to check whether fault field is available
between microversions.

Story: #1596107
Task: #10469

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/574718

Change-Id: I6415d6f84840b601d55c6ce515cc1edeca9fd185
Closes-Bug: #1596107

Change-Id: Idbbe3cf6aa916af49170373c4283188fd1484a38

commit_message:
Switch flavor for Kata containers

This flavor should always have nested virt support (for now until
all of our flavors support it).

Change-Id: Idbbe3cf6aa916af49170373c4283188fd1484a38

Build succeeded.

- nova-dsvm-full-tempest http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/571335/1/ : SUCCESS in 2h 31m 08s'}, {'account_id': 26311, 'date': '2018-05-31 12:00:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6167, 'date': '2018-05-31 16:17:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6062, 'date': '2018-06-01 07:06:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 15888, 'date': '2018-06-01 07:12:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6062, 'date': '2018-06-01 07:25:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6167, 'date': '2018-06-01 18:13:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2018-06-06 02:06:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Yea, server name for multiple create request is with this format {name}-{index +1} [1]. At this time, I am little hesitate to call it "MUST" or API contract as this format is just because it is in that way in code currently.

I am sure that this behaviour might not be known to many user and so does they might not aware that we have this as contracted behaviour or not. 

But that said, it does not mean we cannot make it contracted behavior. I will not oppose to define this API contact if other also things so. 

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/86574f7f8eaf192656c35942140f7eba127a9255/nova/compute/api.py#L1421'}, {'account_id': 5754, 'date': '2018-06-06 03:09:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6062, 'date': '2018-06-06 08:46:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6167, 'date': '2018-06-07 19:21:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 6167, 'date': '2018-06-07 19:31:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Ghanshyam

 > At this time, I am little hesitate to call it "MUST" or API
 > contract as this format is just because it is in that way in code
 > currently.

I am sure this is API contract, because we are considering current implementation/behavior of API is more important than API doc always.
That is the reason why we need to take care of API behavior changes with microversions which is very hard burden.
In addition, this behavior is already written on API reference clearly.
I am not sure what is blocking factor we consider this as API contract.

 > I am sure that this behaviour might not be known to many user and
 > so does they might not aware that we have this as contracted
 > behaviour or not. 

Why you can be sure this behavior is not known by many users even if it is written on API reference?
It is super difficult to know how many users use/depend API behaviors in general, and that is also the reason why we need to keep old API behaviors with microversions actually.'}, {'account_id': 6062, 'date': '2018-06-11 08:32:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6167, 'date': '2018-06-13 18:15:18.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

My main purpose was the corresponding Tempest patch should be merged. So it is not mandatory to merge this patch now.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-30 23:59:45.000000000', 'message': 'Add "must" to automatic names for multiple servers

From the discussion of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/569199
the server names don't seem to become "{name}-{index}" clearly for
some people according to current API reference. And the server name
format can be changed in the future, they said.
Current Nova implementation clearly names the above format and this
patch adds "must" to the API reference.

Change-Id: I66a77bcefc94f1ac550578ce6937c9f27764ec28
'}]
commit_message:
Add "must" to automatic names for multiple servers

From the discussion of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/569199
the server names don't seem to become "{name}-{index}" clearly for
some people according to current API reference. And the server name
format can be changed in the future, they said.
Current Nova implementation clearly names the above format and this
patch adds "must" to the API reference.

Change-Id: I66a77bcefc94f1ac550578ce6937c9f27764ec28

Cleanup exception logging

LOG.exception adds traceback and exception information automatically, so
we don't need to add it explicitly.

Change-Id: I58ea46917b84c7d0ec72f52dfbb451fc85d2e8eb

commit_message:
Remove non-apache job from gate jobs

We're moving the non-apache job to non-voting in heat, so remove it
from the gate jobs in the tempest plugin too.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/567459

commit_message:
Add dependencies for standard-attr-segment extension

Make extension 'standard-attr-segment' depends on extension 'segment'.
In addition, add three optional dependencies: 'standard-attr-description',
'standard-attr-timestamp' and 'standard-attr-revisions'.

neutron-lib: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/562331/

Change-Id: I4beb5700fb283f70ddd3da1e675bb3c655f8016f
Related-Bug: #1760902

 > I built an image (CentOS), tried to run the cluster and I've got:
 > 
 > Creating cluster failed for the following reason(s): Failed to
 > Provision Hadoop Cluster: Command failed to run because this role
 > has invalid configuration. Review and correct its configuration.
 > First error: Enable Stored Notifications in Database is required by
 > Sentry and must be enabled.

Please note that I'm using a test template for sahara-tests derived from the template used by CDH 5.11.0, where SENTRY_SERVER was enabled.
Apparently the requirement of Stored Notifications in Database was added to Sentry in version 5.13; compare:
https://www.cloudera.com/documentation/enterprise/5-12-x/topics/sg_sentry_service_config.html#concept_z5b_42s_p4__section_n4d_4g4_rp
https://www.cloudera.com/documentation/enterprise/5-13-x/topics/sg_sentry_service_config.html#concept_z5b_42s_p4__section_n4d_4g4_rp"}, {'account_id': 8932, 'date': '2018-06-11 17:53:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2018-06-11 18:13:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

check experimental'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2018-06-11 19:45:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2

It looks like that it's working without sentry.
While enabling Sentry should probably enable the required configuration, I think that this could be solved in a follow-up patch.
Unless you have a quick fix."}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2018-06-11 21:57:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

check experimental'}, {'account_id': 23078, 'date': '2018-06-12 15:56:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

-1 for the question about change in the 5.11 folder.'}, {'account_id': 8932, 'date': '2018-06-12 17:05:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 8932, 'date': '2018-06-12 17:07:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 8932, 'date': '2018-06-12 17:23:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7: Patch Set 6 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2018-06-12 22:33:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

(3 comments)

I'm confused: I thought that the position of the configuration key was not correct (the key hive_enable_db_notification was already set, but in another resource file), but even changing it to true (see the comments below), I still get the same error."}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2018-06-13 09:40:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

Do I get it correctly that those json files are just a dump of the default values? It seems that changing their value has no effect.

If it's correct, I'd suggest to keep the value as it is (mirroring the default value) and either remind people to enable it (I can easily do it in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/574769/, already tested) or try to address it in another patch by doing some magic during the provisioning."}, {'account_id': 8932, 'date': '2018-06-13 13:03:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2018-06-13 13:25:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

did you see my last comment too?'}, {'account_id': 8932, 'date': '2018-06-13 14:06:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2018-06-13 14:12:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review+2

So we are basically back at revision 4. Fine by me :)'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2018-06-13 14:17:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

check experimental'}, {'account_id': 23078, 'date': '2018-06-13 14:27:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

> Do I get it correctly that those json files are just a dump of the
 > default values? It seems that changing their value has no effect.
 > 
 > If it's correct, I'd suggest to keep the value as it is (mirroring
 > the default value) and either remind people to enable it (I can
 > easily do it in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/574769/, already
 > tested) or try to address it in another patch by doing some magic
 > during the provisioning.

Yes -- the JSON files are a dump of the default values. The reason why editing the JSON file has no effect on the cluster is because, the only configs which are transferred to cluster from Sahara are those specified by the user in the API call or those recommended by the plugin in the provisioning code. The JSON file is only used for generating the list of config options and their alleged default values to be presented in the UI.


In sahara/plugins/cdh/cloudera_utils.py it ought to be possible to override `hive_enable_db_notification`..."}, {'account_id': 23078, 'date': '2018-06-13 15:16:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-12 16:52:25.000000000', 'message': 'Adding systemd dependencies for NFS mounts

The mount service is dependent on successful starts of
the rpcbind and rpc-statd services and to prevent race conditions
during systemd target.
Proper unit configuration ensures that the mount is completed
before the glance-api service

Change-Id: I6744f01e0648607652d6bb497c8206d37522deac
Closes-Bug: #1774037
'}]
commit_message:
Adding systemd dependencies for NFS mounts

The mount service is dependent on successful starts of
the rpcbind and rpc-statd services and to prevent race conditions
during systemd target.
Proper unit configuration ensures that the mount is completed
before the glance-api service

Change-Id: I6744f01e0648607652d6bb497c8206d37522deac
Closes-Bug: #1774037

commit_message:
Remove mox in test_compute_api.py (3)

Replace mox with mock in the following methods in
nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_api.py.

* _test_resize
* test_resize_invalid_flavor_fails
* test_resize_disabled_flavor_fails

Subsequent patches will remove mox in other test
methods in the file.

Change-Id: Ib806a947987b7e83458a3954e4eddf21d980ab94
Implements: blueprint mox-removal

subject: gabbi require host to be set to something valid
messages:
[{'account_id': 2813, 'date': '2018-06-12 05:01:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-06-12 05:42:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Just repeating what I've mentioned in the ML thread.

I think after https://github.com/cdent/gabbi/pull/243/commits/01993966c179791186977e27c64b9e525a566408 (gabbi === 1.42.0) it just checks for host is not None and we pass empty string here. So it should not fail. 

However, I think the issue is that quuens upper-constraints have gabbi===1.40.0. Unless we can bump that we've to go with this workaround."}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-06-12 06:27:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

I agree with Matthew's comment in ML thread about installing the branchless tempest plugins in a venv to avoid these issues in stable branches rather than doing this hack."}, {'account_id': 2813, 'date': '2018-06-12 08:48:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Maybe I miss something, but we already run the job inside a virtualenv: https://github.com/openstack/telemetry-tempest-plugin/blob/master/telemetry_tempest_plugin/integration/hooks/post_test_hook.sh#L87'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-06-12 09:38:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Maybe I miss something

Possibly you're not installing the tempest plugin in the venv[1] unlike[2], where we enable it using TEMPEST_PLUGINS[3].

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/39/574339/5/check/aodh-dsvm-tempest-plugin-mysql/4654146/logs/devstacklog.txt.gz#_2018-06-12_07_12_14_544

[2] http://logs.openstack.org/07/567207/5/check/heat-functional-orig-mysql-lbaasv2/2b28e0d/logs/devstacklog.txt.gz#_2018-06-09_06_53_31_179

[3] https://github.com/openstack/heat/blob/master/playbooks/devstack/functional/run.yaml#L78"}, {'account_id': 2813, 'date': '2018-06-12 15:17:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Thx, I progress a lot today:

I just see that TEMPEST_PLUGIN == 0 here [1], while we set it here [2].

And when I look there [3], it seems this is not the expected zuul playbook that run... but a very old gate setup.

I need to figure out why this happen, now.

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/39/574339/5/check/aodh-dsvm-tempest-plugin-mysql/4654146/logs/devstacklog.txt.gz#_2018-06-12_07_25_38_285
[2] https://github.com/openstack/telemetry-tempest-plugin/blob/master/playbooks/legacy/telemetry-dsvm-integration-tempest-plugin/run.yaml#L43
[3] http://logs.openstack.org/39/574339/5/check/aodh-dsvm-tempest-plugin-mysql/4654146/job-output.txt.gz'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-06-13 05:14:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> I need to figure out why this happen, now.

Seems like the job 'aodh-dsvm-tempest-plugin-mysql' would run the playbook[1] and not the one you mentioned (in telemetry-tempest-plugin repo - names are different), which seems to enable the tempest plugin differently[2].

[1] https://github.com/openstack/aodh/blob/master/.zuul.yaml#L33
[2] https://github.com/openstack/aodh/blob/master/playbooks/legacy/aodh-dsvm-tempest-plugin-mysql/run.yaml#L46-L48"}, {'account_id': 2813, 'date': '2018-06-13 16:53:33.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

I get the queens gate passing with https://review.openstack.org/#/c/574764  and
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/575099/

Thanks for your help!'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-12 05:01:47.000000000', 'message': 'gabbi require host to be set to something valid

At least of stable/queens branch, all projects that run heat tempest plugin fail with:

Failed to call load_tests:
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/opt/stack/new/tempest/.tox/tempest/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/unittest2/loader.py", line 147, in loadTestsFromModule
    return load_tests(self, tests, pattern)
  File "/opt/stack/new/tempest/.tox/tempest/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/heat_tempest_plugin/tests/api/test_heat_api.py", line 96, in load_tests
    test_loader_name=__name__)
  File "/opt/stack/new/tempest/.tox/tempest/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/gabbi/driver.py", line 88, in build_tests
    'must specify exactly one of host or url, or intercept')
AssertionError: must specify exactly one of host or url, or intercept

This is because gabbi require host to be set to something even if it's not used in tests.

Change-Id: I03c91e279dcbf15b5f074d4b546b19378fab0aa6
'}]
commit_message:
gabbi require host to be set to something valid

At least of stable/queens branch, all projects that run heat tempest plugin fail with:

Failed to call load_tests:
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/opt/stack/new/tempest/.tox/tempest/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/unittest2/loader.py", line 147, in loadTestsFromModule
    return load_tests(self, tests, pattern)
  File "/opt/stack/new/tempest/.tox/tempest/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/heat_tempest_plugin/tests/api/test_heat_api.py", line 96, in load_tests
    test_loader_name=__name__)

    'must specify exactly one of host or url, or intercept')
AssertionError: must specify exactly one of host or url, or intercept

This is because gabbi require host to be set to something even if it's not used in tests.

commit_message:
Add libosinfo to nova

According to the spec, in mitaka libosinfo was added as a helper lib
that *should* be installed, but is safe to be missing.

[0] https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1543800/comments/2

Change-Id: I923fd3181594b8cde1bdd59bd993f1fcd1b6a64d

commit_message:
Neutron: Increase default number of RPC workers

This PS increases the number of default RPC works to a more
sane value - even with a large number of replicas a single worker
thread has difficulty keeping up.

Change-Id: I9a4ce7a88983b52c506b6a5f6253688f8a3aa61e
Depends-On: I705f2ddf3facfe56838f606f88cfb15b822d18a5
Signed-off-by: Pete Birley <pete@port.direct>

commit_message:
Add --shards option to swift-container-info

Previously, swift-container-info would display info about any shard
ranges. This could result in a long output if there are many shard
ranges. Now shard ranges are only displayed if the --shards option is
used.

The number of shard ranges is always displayed.

This patch also adds the shard ranges state timestamp and deleted
values to the output for each shard range.

Change-Id: I8ddebf87e3a13e106ad963875c76cfa9d8ca6cdb

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-25 15:01:07.000000000', 'message': 'authtoken cannot manage python-memcache on RedHat

The keystone::resource::authtoken define does not
have access to the keystone::params class so it
used the package resource title as package name
when trying to install.

This resulted in the non-existing python-memcache
package failed to install on RedHat based systems.

This includes the params class inside the define
so it gets access to the python_memcache_package_name
variable.

Change-Id: I3470292d87620db717251092fbacf16b2cace571
Closes-Bug: 1711437
'}, {'created': '2018-04-25 17:17:22.000000000', 'message': 'authtoken cannot manage python-memcache on RedHat

commit_message:
authtoken cannot manage python-memcache on RedHat

The keystone::resource::authtoken define does not
have access to the keystone::params class so it
used the package resource title as package name
when trying to install.

This resulted in the non-existing python-memcache
package failed to install on RedHat based systems.

This includes the params class inside the define
so it gets access to the python_memcache_package_name
variable.

Change-Id: I3470292d87620db717251092fbacf16b2cace571
Closes-Bug: 1711437

commit_message:
[evil][ci] Preparing to remove all OpenStack in-tree plugins

Installing 'rally-openstack' package in our devstack plugin can simplify
adoption of a new package, i.e no need to rework legacy jobs while
porting custom plugins to use new package.

Also, this patch removes checking for openstack samples, since it should
be done in rally-openstack repo

Change-Id: I3446ccd5a36cb686282e85a9ea210d1723da1fef

This user, passwordless will be used by Docker Healthcheck script to
test if MySQL is actually running without root credentials.

Sorry for the unhelpful comment, I just wanted to mention this in case someone has a better memory than I do :)"}, {'account_id': 20778, 'date': '2018-06-13 08:10:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

> I vaguely recall we did something to grant the mysql user the

 > can't remember exactly what that was or where it was living. Maybe
 > the code was moved or even deleted? Sorry for the unhelpful
 > comment, I just wanted to mention this in case someone has a better
 > memory than I do :)

I didn't have time to reproduce locally yet, but I think the problem here is that all users set up by kolla have a password associated with them. So the simplest thing IMHO would be to store those credential in a config file and make sure that kolla_start copies those file in the user's .my.cnf

Now we need to figure out which user we want to use. I'm currently deploying a containerized undercloud to work on that"}, {'account_id': 13039, 'date': '2018-06-13 08:23:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

aha!! Found it :)

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508504/'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-06-13 12:34:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Damien: the user used to run the healthcheck is "mysql", so the CLI is looking for either /etc/mysql/my.cnf or /var/lib/mysql/.my.cnf I think.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-06-13 16:20:08.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

i'll fix it in another patch in THT, follow https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1776570"}]

commit_message:
healthcheck/mariadb: run mysql with healthcheck user

The script is run as 'mysql' user, therefore it can't use mysql command
without root credentials. This patch changes it so we use the new
'healthcheck' user that is password-less.

Closes-Bug: #1776570
Change-Id: I7c6cd72879df0b35ac4d30393dc2c7500fdadf6a
Depends-On: I43d8015ffc5575c7232298d5fbd1415cab76aab6

Change-Id: I6c0fa078da3f32b542d3a3492a0fb79c822a5f8d
"}, {'created': '2018-06-07 12:35:08.000000000', 'message': 'get-ansible-role-requiremnets: Use refspec to try Gerrit changes

Without this patch, deployers have to mimic zuul structure
to locally test Gerrit patches in-depth, with their specific
references, before they are merged into the main tree.

This is a problem for people wanting to not change the location
of the openstack-ansible folder.

This patches solves the problem by using the refspec
parameter of the ansible git module: A user can then
edit its own ansible-role-requirements for testing
patches.

Change-Id: I6c0fa078da3f32b542d3a3492a0fb79c822a5f8d
'}]
commit_message:
get-ansible-role-requiremnets: Use refspec to try Gerrit changes

Without this patch, deployers have to mimic zuul structure
to locally test Gerrit patches in-depth, with their specific
references, before they are merged into the main tree.

This is a problem for people wanting to not change the location
of the openstack-ansible folder.

This patches solves the problem by using the refspec
parameter of the ansible git module: A user can then
edit its own ansible-role-requirements for testing
patches.

Change-Id: I6c0fa078da3f32b542d3a3492a0fb79c822a5f8d

IDEA additional info:
Subsystem: com.intellij.openapi.diff.impl.patch.CharsetEP
<+>US-ASCII
===================================================================
--- elements/ubuntu-cifs/install.d/50-manila-cifs       (revision 8441651e09535c2f6da6e543423f5f4c71f64c2f)
+++ elements/ubuntu-cifs/install.d/50-manila-cifs       (revision )
@@ -2,4 +2,4 @@
 
 set -eu
 
-install-packages samba samba-common samba-common-bin cifs-utils
+install-packages samba samba-common samba-common-bin cifs-utils samba-dsdb-modules libnss-winbind krb5-user libpam-winbind krb5-config krb5-locales winbind ntp ntpdate'}, {'account_id': 26768, 'date': '2017-09-01 15:55:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

But it might be good idea to separate manila-cifs and manila-cifs-ad to let the user choose whether to install unneeded packages.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-09-01 17:05:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified+1

Should/Cloud we use one of theses tools maybe?'}, {'account_id': 26768, 'date': '2017-10-02 10:32:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

(4 comments)

> (4 comments)
 > 
 > In general it feels imo wrong to invent more and more config stuff
 > inside of manila. There are plenty of tools (salt, ansible, puppet,
 > chef, ...) to configure services on a machine. Should/Cloud we use
 > one of theses tools maybe?

Well, I agree with you. It's not clean solution but using these configuration services would mean a lot more work to integrate them to manila. This patch just extends the functionality given in CIFSUserHelper (which is kind of useful without external user verification) in a way that utilizes manila's structures for storing external security services details and whole setup of this service take place runtime as in other drivers."}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2018-06-09 23:03:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Patch Set 3 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2018-06-09 23:06:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

The OpenStack community as a whole has agreed to approach patches more with the idea of "do they make the product better?" than with "are they perfect and solve all related issues"?  So I think we may be able to acknowledge the validity of Tom Bechtold's points and still move this forward as an incremental improvement.

Rebased.'}, {'account_id': 24863, 'date': '2018-06-10 04:30:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Jan, this will fail until the required patches are added to the service image, right?

I understand not doing the work to do that until there is buy in for this patch, but you could perhaps put it on the manila weekly meeting agenda to see if you can get buy-in for the idea from the manila folks who care most about the manila service instance module.'}, {'account_id': 26768, 'date': '2018-06-13 09:17:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> Jan, this will fail until the required patches are added to the
 > service image, right?
 >

 > for this patch, but you could perhaps put it on the manila weekly
 > meeting agenda to see if you can get buy-in for the idea from the
 > manila folks who care most about the manila service instance
 > module.

Hello Tom, exactly, the packages given in commit message have to be added to service image in order to correct functionality. Nevertheless, cloud operator could use a custom image (containing these packages) created with simple tweak in manila-image-elements.

You are completely right with the situation as it seems that there is no interest in this functionality. The idea of putting it into weekly meeting agenda seems great but to be honest I don't know how :)"}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2018-06-13 16:06:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Jan, I'll accumulate a few stalled generic driver or CIFS issues and aim to get them in a weekly agenda session pretty soon.  Will ping you when ready."}]

commit_message:
CIFS user helper with Active directory support

Added helper that automatically joins samba server to AD domain
and uses it to verify users.

Following packages has to be added to service image:
libnss-winbind
krb5-user
libpam-winbind
krb5-config
krb5-locales
winbind
ntp
ntpdate

Change-Id: Id0146391d6c6369e470058681d837f72602d49b1
Closes-Bug: 1703560

commit_message:
DNM: Depends on intel-nfv-ci-tests to test NUMA LM

This change depends on a patch in intel-nfv-ci-tests that tests NUMA
aware live migration. It is necessary because Intel NFV 3rd party CI
triggers on Nova changes, not changes to the intel-nfv-ci-tests
tempest plugin code.

Depends-on: I2fb1e5a96139662a6da2d042f27c21162de76043
Change-Id: Ifef62fe11dcd12563b6f48beb3f64b5becfc008a

commit_message:
Gate upgrades again

Without this patch, nova upgrades are not tested.
We can bring the upgrades back now that the SPICE url
change has been merged in Queens.

This is a problem, as we could miss an important upstream
change, or break our upgrades ourselves without noticing.

This patches solves the problem.

Change-Id: Ie46429433af6449e05f3d713060c0074df9d3476

Sorry I have tested manually the previous wait loop, by doing something like:
(sleep 2; touch /var/lib/mysql/mariadb.pid ) &
    TIMEOUT=${DB_MAX_TIMEOUT:-60}
    while [[ ! -S /var/lib/mysql/mysql.sock ]] && \
          [[ ! -S /var/run/mysqld/mysqld.sock ]] || \
          [[ ! -f /var/lib/mysql/mariadb.pid ]]; do
        if [[ ${TIMEOUT} -gt 0 ]]; then
            let TIMEOUT-=1
            sleep 1
        else
            exit 1
        fi
    done

and the wait wouldn't finish. So it seems to me that the previous loop is correct: it would exit only if both the socket and the pidfile are created by the server.

Ultimately we will probably have a stronger guarantee of being able to target mysqld by running a simple test like "mysqladmin ping". The rest of the file already uses mysqladmin so it shouldn't be an added dependency.

I'd like to -1-worflow that review temporarily until i detail what went wrong in the first place when we hit the problem in https://bugs.launchpad.net/kolla/+bug/1775864.

This will also give us time to test that the mysqladmin ping route is both robust and simpler?'}, {'account_id': 13039, 'date': '2018-06-13 10:19:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow-1

-W as requested by Damien'}, {'account_id': 13039, 'date': '2018-06-13 10:23:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> Sorry I have tested manually the previous wait loop, by doing
 > something like:
 > (sleep 2; touch /var/lib/mysql/mariadb.pid ) &
 > TIMEOUT=${DB_MAX_TIMEOUT:-60}
 > while [[ ! -S /var/lib/mysql/mysql.sock ]] && \
 > [[ ! -S /var/run/mysqld/mysqld.sock ]] || \
 > [[ ! -f /var/lib/mysql/mariadb.pid ]]; do
 > if [[ ${TIMEOUT} -gt 0 ]]; then
 > let TIMEOUT-=1
 > sleep 1
 > else
 > exit 1
 > fi
 > done
 > 
 > and the wait wouldn't finish. So it seems to me that the previous
 > loop is correct: it would exit only if both the socket and the
 > pidfile are created by the server.
 > 
 > Ultimately we will probably have a stronger guarantee of being able
 > to target mysqld by running a simple test like "mysqladmin ping".
 > The rest of the file already uses mysqladmin so it shouldn't be an
 > added dependency.
 > 
 > I'd like to -1-worflow that review temporarily until i detail what
 > went wrong in the first place when we hit the problem in
 > https://bugs.launchpad.net/kolla/+bug/1775864.
 > 
 > This will also give us time to test that the mysqladmin ping route
 > is both robust and simpler?

This makes sense, yeah. It would indeed be better to rely on the status as reported by mariadb directly than on a list of expected files.'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-06-13 10:26:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

You're right Damien. I'm recalled of https://github.com/openstack/fuel-library/blob/0678e4c48c7d1112e8f79214143b940fd83585b2/files/fuel-ha-utils/ocf/mysql-wss#L756 now, and we can only be sure the node is ready when there is sock file, pid file AND no SST in progress. The way to detect SST is too tricky and mysql distro/configuration specific... So prolly mysql ping or select 1 would be a nice addition to make this less racy."}, {'account_id': 20778, 'date': '2018-06-13 10:32:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

 > tricky and mysql distro/configuration specific... So prolly mysql
 > ping or select 1 would be a nice addition to make this less racy.

Well in that case SST is not really an issue because we're bootstrapping the node and we force wsrep off. But still I think having mysqladmin ping gives us stronger guarantee than the server is available for processing SQL commands"}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-06-13 11:31:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 11090, 'date': '2018-06-13 11:43:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Right, that's on purpose. I meant the original kolla check behaves like what is currently proposed in Patch Set 3. 

function orig_kolla_check() { TIMEOUT=${DB_MAX_TIMEOUT:-60}; while [[ ! -S /var/lib/mysql/mysql.sock ]] && [[ ! -S /var/run/mysqld/mysqld.sock ]] || [[ ! -f /var/lib/mysql/mariadb.pid ]]; do if [[ ${TIMEOUT} -gt 0 ]]; then let TIMEOUT-=1; sleep 1; else echo "---"; return 0; fi; done; echo "+++"; }

# orig_kolla_check

{wait some time}

So I think we want to guarantee that mysql is up _and_ it's ready to process commands, and using "mysqladmin ping" is probably a clean means of ensuring both conditions at once.'}, {'account_id': 11090, 'date': '2018-06-13 15:41:36.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

commit_message:
Change condition creteria in MariaDB bootstrap.

There are cases when pid file is present but DB is not ready to accept
connections. As an example innodb recovery. This patch changes the criteria to
meet pid file with sock file as a criteria of running MariaDB.

Change-Id: I2ac19301667960a02b2f763f9c46b381cddcb4c2
Closes-Bug: 1775864

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-11 12:06:34.000000000', 'message': "Remove deploy playbook from `update run`

We need the deploy steps as part of update playbook, to execute them
with `serial: 1` (we need to start services on node A before
proceeding to update node B). This is already happening correctly
within the update playbook.

After the update playbook we have been additionaly running deploy
playbook on all nodes in parallel. That seems like a superfluous
operation, in some environments considerably prolonging the time for
minor update. The full deployment will be once again executed on all
nodes in parallel during `update converge`, we don't need to do it in
`update run` too.

Change-Id: I513f655707c8a31f3621b96a756be9c468e3bd8b
Closes-Bug: #1776206
"}]
commit_message:
Remove deploy playbook from `update run`

We need the deploy steps as part of update playbook, to execute them
with `serial: 1` (we need to start services on node A before
proceeding to update node B). This is already happening correctly
within the update playbook.

After the update playbook we have been additionaly running deploy
playbook on all nodes in parallel. That seems like a superfluous
operation, in some environments considerably prolonging the time for
minor update. The full deployment will be once again executed on all
nodes in parallel during `update converge`, we don't need to do it in
`update run` too.

Change-Id: I513f655707c8a31f3621b96a756be9c468e3bd8b
Closes-Bug: #1776206

Add openshift params to containers prepare cmd

This wires the parameters used to configure the OpenShift container
images for the container image prepare command.

subject: Pin packages for Ceph correctly
messages:
[{'account_id': 2799, 'date': '2018-04-27 13:59:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 2799, 'date': '2018-04-27 14:19:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 17799, 'date': '2018-04-27 15:31:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

check experimental'}, {'account_id': 2799, 'date': '2018-04-27 16:40:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Workflow-1

we should discuss this - i think the current approach is bad but it may be better than the other option, since you can't install a Jewel client /w Cinder UCA pike for example, the deps will fail:

The following packages have unmet dependencies:
 qemu-block-extra : Depends: librbd1 (>= 12.0.3) but 10.2.10-1xenial is to be installed"}, {'account_id': 2799, 'date': '2018-06-13 15:11:51.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

There is no way this can work unfortunately. You will get the newer package out of the ceph repo or the UCA/RDO repos due to dependencies on packages that are not in the Ceph repo. This will mean your clients will at least match the ceph cluster, or be newer which is acceptable since the clients will work with older ceph clusters.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-27 13:59:26.000000000', 'message': 'Pin packages for Ceph correctly

The current approach to pinning packages for Ceph does not work,
resulting in whatever packages are in UCA getting deployed. This means
that a Pike deploy with Jewel set as the ceph_stable_release will end up
with Luminous clients (for example).

To fix this we should set a specific name for the package pin conf file,
to prevent overwriting existing pins, and we should utilise the origin
type specifying the specific repository as the origin from which to
prioritise packages.

Change-Id: I8128d123b748c2cb19cd61dd8aa623fdc3f4871e
'}, {'created': '2018-04-27 14:19:48.000000000', 'message': 'Pin packages for Ceph correctly

The current approach to pinning packages for Ceph does not work,
resulting in whatever packages are in UCA getting deployed. This means
that a Pike deploy with Jewel set as the ceph_stable_release will end up
with Luminous clients (for example).

To fix this we should set a specific name for the package pin conf file,
to prevent overwriting existing pins, and we should utilise the origin
type specifying the specific repository as the origin from which to
prioritise packages.

Change-Id: I8128d123b748c2cb19cd61dd8aa623fdc3f4871e
'}]
commit_message:
Pin packages for Ceph correctly

The current approach to pinning packages for Ceph does not work,
resulting in whatever packages are in UCA getting deployed. This means
that a Pike deploy with Jewel set as the ceph_stable_release will end up
with Luminous clients (for example).

To fix this we should set a specific name for the package pin conf file,
to prevent overwriting existing pins, and we should utilise the origin
type specifying the specific repository as the origin from which to
prioritise packages.

Change-Id: I8128d123b748c2cb19cd61dd8aa623fdc3f4871e

According to official site,
https://packaging.python.org/guides/analyzing-pypi-package-downloads/

should be removed.

commit_message:
Switch to oslo_messaging.ConfFixture.transport_url

oslo_messaging's rpc_backend setting, which is set by
ConfFixture.transport_driver has been deprecated since Newton. To allow
oslo_messaging to remove it, switch to setting transport_url instead.

Change-Id: I0cee8383d5cc2f899f7e31f7aa9ae6bf1d81ebe5

Yea, there is no consensus on nova patch and i am ok to go with what currently written in api ref.

We can revert this if there is any objection on considering this server name format as API contract.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-06-13 14:32:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

This is causing the nova-cells-v1 job to intermittently fail:

http://logstash.openstack.org/#dashboard/file/logstash.json?query=message%3A%5C%22self.assertEqual(set(%5B'VM-1'%2C%20'VM-2'%5D)%2C%20server_names)%5C%22%20AND%20tags%3A%5C%22console%5C%22&from=7d"}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-06-13 14:39:11.000000000', 'content': 'Created a revert of this change as Ia9273be6bf9fd55822dfe46f56503f70953c3ff3'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-06-13 14:45:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Note that prior to removal of the config option in Queens:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/499612/

This could make tempest fail on any deployment that had a non-standard multi-server name template configured.

So really, this change to tempest is likely something that shouldn't be done until nova's pike branch enters extended maintenance."}]

commit_message:
Add server name check for multiple creations

As https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/#create-multiple-servers
the server names become {name}-1, {name}-2, {name}-3 by default.
Then this patch adds the corresponding check on Tempest.
NOTE: This comes from a review If5369bcf4a6f7fc36190e153776e60446eb14040

Change-Id: I2b544d4ccb54cb5e6db71f788926ac13be7a4fe0

[{'created': '2018-06-13 10:28:12.000000000', 'message': 'Add python3 django 1.11 job instead of django 2.0 job

Django 2.0 is now used in tox py35 job, so there is no need for
py35dj20 job. Instead, Django 1.11 with python3 is not covered.

- py35dj20 job is dropped from tox.ini.
- python3-django111 is added to tox.ini.
  python3 is specified to basepython to avoid a specific python version.
- .zuul.yaml is updated to consume horizon-openstack-tox-python3-django111
  and drop horizon-openstack-tox-py35dj20.

Change-Id: I50713dab7f944cbb9cbead3f00c95be7bb9c623e
'}]
commit_message:
Add python3 django 1.11 job instead of django 2.0 job

Django 2.0 is now used in tox py35 job, so there is no need for
py35dj20 job. Instead, Django 1.11 with python3 is not covered.

- py35dj20 job is dropped from tox.ini.
- python3-django111 is added to tox.ini.
  python3 is specified to basepython to avoid a specific python version.
- .zuul.yaml is updated to consume horizon-openstack-tox-python3-django111
  and drop horizon-openstack-tox-py35dj20.

Change-Id: I50713dab7f944cbb9cbead3f00c95be7bb9c623e

package conflicts, we only allow a small subset of packages from the

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/574801/
Change-Id: Icd4d09a26cd95ecfefec26142723ddffe81aae74
"}, {'created': '2018-06-13 07:37:19.000000000', 'message': "redhat: Add the EPEL repository for aria2 and python2-lxc packages

The ARIA2 package is needed from EPEL so we install it inside
the role. Moreover, in order to minimize the potential EPEL vs RDO
package conflicts, we only allow a small subset of packages from the
EPEL repository. This also removes the 'debootstrap' package from
CentOS since it's not needed. Finally, we include the nodepool playbook
from the tests repository in order to populate the necessary CI facts.

commit_message:
redhat: Add the EPEL repository for aria2 and python2-lxc packages

The ARIA2 package is needed from EPEL so we install it inside
the role. Moreover, in order to minimize the potential EPEL vs RDO
package conflicts, we only allow a small subset of packages from the
EPEL repository. This also removes the 'debootstrap' package from
CentOS since it's not needed. Finally, we include the nodepool playbook
from the tests repository in order to populate the necessary CI facts.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/574801/
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/575059/
Change-Id: Icd4d09a26cd95ecfefec26142723ddffe81aae74
Co-Authored-By: Markos Chandras <mchandras@suse.de>

commit_message:
Cleanup l3_odl_v2 code

Some cleanup in preparation for fixing bug #1738246:
 * Remove session.begin code since it doesn't actually do anything.
 * Simplify dependency list construction in delete_floatingip
 * Remove comment from rcurran since it's already handled
 * Remove get_floatingip mocking from tests set up since it doesn't do
   anything but will interfere with any proper testing (next patch).

Change-Id: I6e718d3943a0c958d6717ba242c069a855e07c83
Partial-Bug: #1738246

heat tests wre moved out of tempest for quite a long time already,
with options deprecated. Their presence also forces heat's tempest
plugin to use another name for service and config section
('heat_plugin').

This patch removes those heat options from tempest finally.

commit_message:
Remove heat's config options

heat tests wre moved out of tempest for quite a long time already,
with options deprecated. Their presence also forces heat's tempest
plugin to use another name for service and config section
('heat_plugin').

This patch removes those heat options from tempest finally.
The heat's service client is left in place just in case it is used
somewhere else.

Change-Id: I06a5bf91c908eaea7051e83fad1d7ebef0ecb9a5

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-07 07:41:50.000000000', 'message': 'Remove volume v2 service client warning

with moving the volume testing to v3 API, commit
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/536121/ moved all the
volume v2 service client into v3 service client.

That added warning msg on usage of volume v2 service client.

tempest/clients.py provide the alias for volume v2 service client
but instantiating those. Which intern leads to lot of warning msg in
logs.

As v2 service clients are nothing but directing to v3, this commit
change the v2 service client alias to point to v3 service clients.

next we will do more cleanup on service client alias and name all of
them as *_latest.

Change-Id: Ia48582c2e703c68450ead4bc288f9e64b375e92f
'}]
commit_message:
Remove volume v2 service client warning

with moving the volume testing to v3 API, commit
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/536121/ moved all the
volume v2 service client into v3 service client.

That added warning msg on usage of volume v2 service client.

tempest/clients.py provide the alias for volume v2 service client
but instantiating those. Which intern leads to lot of warning msg in
logs.

As v2 service clients are nothing but directing to v3, this commit
change the v2 service client alias to point to v3 service clients.

next we will do more cleanup on service client alias and name all of
them as *_latest.

Change-Id: Ia48582c2e703c68450ead4bc288f9e64b375e92f

commit_message:
deepcopy binding and binding levels avoid expiration

Perform a deepcopy on the sqla objects passed into the PortContext
so we get detached versions of them safe to reference forever.
This is necessary because the PortContexts outlive the
transaction context managers they are creating in which means an
object can be expired and result in a query after a commit
(e.g. in bind_port_if_needed) that will fail and result in an
exception.

This required a few additional explicit session.merge calls to deal
with cases where touching the mech context was implicitly expected
to modify the DB state on the next commit.

Closes-Bug: #1669528
Change-Id: Ib5ba2daa80acba53c082bade1f61a3ee44ca41fc

commit_message:
Update all SHAs for 16.0.15

This patch updates all the roles to the latest available stable
SHA's, copies the release notes from the updated roles into the
integrated repo, updates all the OpenStack Service SHA's, and
updates the appropriate python requirements pins.

Depends-On: I99f6724aae0fd27b68f96014d97d2ba2b5fe14fd
Change-Id: Iafb3c681233c5fc7114c59a817260c0f038fe3b6

commit_message:
Configure privsep helper in neutron-netns-cleanup

This closes a bug that makes netns-cleanup crash when
trying to invoke privsep helper, because the rootwrap
config isn't correctly passed down to the privsep helper
library.

Closes-Bug: #1776468

Change-Id: I8258a44a9e2542ec222ebac72c4b889858ab2fc2

commit_message:
Add missing nfs_mount_options for Cinder Netapp backend

Add nfs_mount_options parameter when instantiating cinder::backend::netapp.
The value maps to the CinderNetappNfsMountOptions THT parameter.

Closes-Bug: #1773013
Change-Id: I0f6fff63a5c3d795572c8f4df98d45ae486ca19d

commit_message:
Add support for using distribution packages for OpenStack services

Distributions provide packages for the OpenStack services so we add
support for using these instead of the pip ones.

Change-Id: I5bfcaff1bdc6ce74fb9f4839ecb73bf01d448280
Implements: blueprint openstack-distribution-packages

commit_message:
Use current kubernetes API version

This PS moves to use the current API version for kubernetes rcs'
that were previously using `apps/v1beta1`.

Story: 2002205
Task: 21735

Change-Id: Icb4e7aa2392da6867427a58926be2da6f424bd56
Signed-off-by: Pete Birley <pete@port.direct>

commit_message:
Revert "Install EPEL repositories manually and exclude Python packages"

This reverts commit 0b32750d1162f0fa8a04d44a68912129fbdbbd5c.

Installing EPEL globally is causing package conflicts with the RDO
repository so we should only install it when necessary. This also
ensures that the epel-release package is absent.

Change-Id: I90b375f67455b7d5c3dba25c3ff1579afaad1da2

(1 comment)

good idea 


another question is in conf/compute.py

205 NOTE: This can be set per-compute, or if set to 0.0, the value
206 set on the scheduler node(s) or compute node(s) will be used
207 and defaulted to 16.0'.

how you get it from scheduler if it's 0.0 ?"}, {'account_id': 17532, 'date': '2016-08-25 02:35:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)

@jichenjc
Scheduler get compute_node object, and then call the 
following function，when cpu_allocation_ratio is 0.0, it
will set it to 16.0.

In /nova/objects/compute_node.py, the function is _from_db_object:
   value = getattr(CONF, key)
   if value == 0.0 and key == 'cpu_allocation_ratio':
       # It's not specified either on the controller
       value = 16.0
   if value == 0.0 and key == 'ram_allocation_ratio':
       # It's not specified either on the controller
       value = 1.5
   if value == 0.0 and key == 'disk_allocation_ratio':
       # It's not specified either on the controller
       value = 1.0"}, {'account_id': 17532, 'date': '2016-08-25 05:42:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-08-25 05:47:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Verified+1

thanks for point that out

that's the value by default? seems https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/conf/compute.py#L205 still confusing me 
will dig more here

anyway, thanks for the update of API part"}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2017-03-24 20:36:28.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

This looks abandoned. If you plan on pursuing this, please update it for the Pike release.'}, {'account_id': 24268, 'date': '2018-06-13 06:35:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

> Abandoned
 > 
 > This looks abandoned. If you plan on pursuing this, please update
 > it for the Pike release.

I start a new bp about this: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova-hyper/+spec/add-ratio-to-hyper'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-06-13 12:39:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

@jiang wei, thanks, but I think you want this project:

https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova

The spec will also need to be re-proposed for the stein release once that opens up.'}]

commit_message:
OS::Nova::Server: Extend addresses attr to include subnets

This change adds 'subnets' to the addresses attribute of the
OS::Nova::Server resource. This enables resolving the subnet
properties for the server resource which brings parity with
OS::Neutron::Port's 'subnets' attribute.

Story: 1766946
Task: 19689
Change-Id: I6927f1e142e83df7258e259bffc86819e4cbe881

commit_message:
Remove direct branching rights for murano-apps

Branching now goes through requests to openstack/releases,
so that it can be properly tested before the branch is created.
Murano-apps never created a branch, but in case future branches
are needed, those would go through openstack/releases changes.

Change-Id: I7fa5d9b6618288412ba435a4e07a7d4d89f15e6a

commit_message:
replace windows line endings with unix format

Under python 3 the linter does not like line endings like \r\n so
replace them with \n.

Change-Id: Iaa401a7943a0df29b82482bc92451dca22ebc309
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Fix ACLs for tripleo-ci and dib-utils

The release process for official OpenStack components now uses
release requests using changes proposed to the openstack/releases
git repository. This allows peer review of release requests,
including version numbers, and run a series of checks to make
sure the release is likely to be successful once the tag is
pushed. The same process supports the creation of additional repo
branches as well. This all ensures that releases are reported
correctly on the releases.openstack.org website.

As a result of this process, nobody needs to push tags directly
or create branches directly. tripleo-ci and dib-utils are under
the TripleO team and should be fixed.

For dib-utils, the simplest is to switch it to using the tripleo
ACLs, since it's now owned by that team.

Change-Id: I5f40f2318fe3a15fca630e32c2dfcb73104ec403

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-23 00:13:55.000000000', 'message': 'Avoid unnecessary joins in HostManager._get_instances_by_host

While getting a HostState object for a given compute node during
scheduling, if the HostState does not have its instance info
set, either because it's out of date or because config option
"track_instance_changes" is False, the HostManager still pulls
the list of instances for that host from the database and stores
it in HostState.instances.

This is *only* used (in-tree) by the affinity filters and even
then the only thing those filters use from HostState.instances
is the set of keys from the dict, which is the list of instance
UUIDs on a given host. The actual Instance objects aren't used
at all. See blueprint put-host-manager-instance-info-on-a-diet
for more details on that.

The point of this change, is that when we go to pull the set
of instances from the database for a given host, we don't need
to join on the default columns (info_cache and security_groups)
defined in the _instance_get_all_query() method in the DB API.

This should be at least some minor optimization in scheduling
for hosts that have several instances on them in a large cloud.
As noted in the comment in the code, any out of tree filters
that rely on using the info_cache or security_groups from the
instance are now going to be hit with a lazy-load penalty
per instance, but we have no contract on out of tree filters
so if this happens, the people maintaining said filters can
(1) live with it (2) fork the HostManager code or (3) upstream
their filter so it's in-tree.

A more impactful change would be to refactor
HostManager._get_host_states to bulk query the instances on
the given set of compute nodes in a single query per cell. But
that is left for a later change.

Change-Id: Iccefbfdfa578515a004ef6ac718bac1a49d5c5fd
Partial-Bug: #1737465
(cherry picked from commit a1a335f19a986a593487a802d7b9448f7efc5bab)
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid unnecessary joins in HostManager._get_instances_by_host

While getting a HostState object for a given compute node during
scheduling, if the HostState does not have its instance info
set, either because it's out of date or because config option
"track_instance_changes" is False, the HostManager still pulls
the list of instances for that host from the database and stores
it in HostState.instances.

This is *only* used (in-tree) by the affinity filters and even
then the only thing those filters use from HostState.instances
is the set of keys from the dict, which is the list of instance
UUIDs on a given host. The actual Instance objects aren't used
at all. See blueprint put-host-manager-instance-info-on-a-diet
for more details on that.

The point of this change, is that when we go to pull the set
of instances from the database for a given host, we don't need
to join on the default columns (info_cache and security_groups)
defined in the _instance_get_all_query() method in the DB API.

This should be at least some minor optimization in scheduling
for hosts that have several instances on them in a large cloud.
As noted in the comment in the code, any out of tree filters
that rely on using the info_cache or security_groups from the
instance are now going to be hit with a lazy-load penalty
per instance, but we have no contract on out of tree filters
so if this happens, the people maintaining said filters can
(1) live with it (2) fork the HostManager code or (3) upstream
their filter so it's in-tree.

A more impactful change would be to refactor
HostManager._get_host_states to bulk query the instances on
the given set of compute nodes in a single query per cell. But
